She has applied for a loan of which she will utilize Ksh 30,000 to prepare her land and plant seedlings, buy a sewing machine worth Kshs 7,000, and pay for transport and miscellaneous expenses with Ksh 3,000.

With the extra earnings from this loan Josephine plans to expand her tailoring school and advertise it. Her dream is to see the tailoring school expand and improve the lives of her students.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and plant seedlings, buy a sewing machine, and pay transport costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jacqueline de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en el Guasmo de Guayaquil, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de seguridad, ellos tienen tres hijos, empezó como microempresaria con una tienda hace un año atrás, con el fin de ayudar con los gastos familiares y darle una mejor vida a sus hijos. 

Empezó readecuando la sala de su casa y convirtiéndola en un local pequeño para su tienda, compro víveres y papelería para su negocio. Por esa buena decisión ahora ella tiene una tienda mixta con víveres y papelería, trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 19h00 todos los días. Quiere que su tienda este mas surtida por lo que con el préstamo quiere comprar vitrinas, laminas y víveres para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere agrandar su tienda y tener sucursales.
texts.en:
Jacqueline is 39 years old and lives in the urban area of Guasmo in Guayaquil. Her husband works for a security company. They have three children. Jacqueline started her business one year ago so that she could contribute toward the family expenses and provide her children with a better life.

She remodeled the living room of her house and converted it into a small space for her business. This turned out to be a good decision because she now has a general store that offers both groceries and stationery. She works from 7am until 7pm every day. Jacqueline wants her store to be well-stocked, so she will use her loan to buy display cases, printing supplies, and groceries for her store.

In the future, she wants to expand her store and open branches.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase display cases, printing supplies, and groceries

loans.name: Massan Afi Dodji

texts.fr:
Cette dame est une femme très dynamique, elle s’est lancée en 2001 dans le commerce de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, sa clientèle grandit et son stock actuel ne peut répondre à la demande de tous ses  clients, pour rémédier à cela elle sollicite chez wages son premier crédit pour acheter  10  pagnes Holand et 25 pagnes HI target.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle contribue avec son revenu aux charges financières de la famille.
texts.en:
This lady is very dynamic and began trading in "pagnes" (West African colourful fabric) in 2001. She gets her supplies at the large market in Lomé. Her customer base is growing and her current stock is not sufficient to meet the demand of all her customers. In order to remedy this she is requesting a first loan from WAGES to buy 10 Holand "pagnes" and 25 HI Target "pagnes". She is married and mother to two children. With her income she contributes to the household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of "pagnes"

loans.name: Kon

texts.en: Kon C., 36, lives in Chvea village, in Takeo province.  She is a recycler of various items and earns some money to support her family.  Her husband is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family.  They support four children, three of whom attend a local public school.  The other is a seamstress in garment factory.  So to improve production, Kon is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: Buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos, está casado y es padre de una hija a la cual educa y apoya en su educación.

Carlos es un joven muy dedicado a su trabajo, el trabaja como moto taxista en el sindicado “10 de Noviembre” en el trópico de Cochabamba ya como 2 años, el trabaja día a día para que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones, él es una persona muy responsable, el cuenta con su motocicleta para mantener a su familia ya que es la única fuente de ingreso con la que el cuenta. 

El señor Carlos se apersono a las oficinas en busca de un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta para así poder trabajar con su propia motocicleta y no simplemente como chofer y así poder tener más ingresos para el bienestar de su familia y poder brindarles un futuro mejor a ellos.
texts.en:
Carlos is married and the father of a daughter he is educating. Carlos is a young man who is very dedicated to his work. He has worked as a motorcycle taxi driver with a group called "10 de Noviembre" in the tropic of Cochabamba for two years. He works day after day so his family can have better living conditions. He is a very responsible person who counts on his motorcycle to support his family since it is the only source of income he has. Mr. Carlos came in person to our office searching for a loan to buy a motorcycle so he can have his own motorcycle for work and not just be a driver. This will be a way to earn more money for the good of his family and to provide them with a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to work as a Taxi driver.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Home repairs

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca M. is from the city of Hinagdong, Ozamiz City. She is 40 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Rebecca owns and operates a farming business, planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Rebecca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Rebecca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rebecca has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rebecca is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rebecca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna G. is from the town of Banga. She is 25 years old and is married with a 7-year-old child.

Lorna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over three years.

Lorna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs. This loan will be her second from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 56 años, vive con sus hermanas en su casa que es propia. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las diversas tareas del campo sembrando papa, olluco, trigo entre otros productos más y para realizar estas tareas recibe el apoyo de sus hermanas, pero cuando requiere de hacer un trabajo más arduo, contrata el servicio de mano de obra de peones.  Cada día verifica las tierras que ha cultivado, asimismo se va a pastear sus ovejas al campo mientras espera que maduren los productos sembrados para que pueda cosecharlos y ser llevados al mercado de abastos de la ciudad mas cercana para su respectiva comercialización. Los recursos económicos que le genera esta actividad le ha motivado a seguir esforzándose, es por ello que desea intensificarse en esta actividad. Es su séptimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de papa y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Lucia is 56 years old and lives with her sisters in her own house. Since her childhood she has worked at different jobs in the countryside sowing potatoes, olluco [a tuber] and wheat among other products, and to carry out these tasks she receives her sisters' support, but when she needs to do a more arduous job, she hires laborers. Each day she checks over the lands she has farmed. She also goes to graze her sheep in the countryside while she waits for the planted products to mature so she can harvest them and take them to the suppliers' market in the nearest city so they can be sold. The economic resources that this activity generates for her have motivated her to keep trying. For this reason she wants to increase this activity. It is Lucia's seventh loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support because she has always shown that she is responsible with her payments. She is also grateful to be part of her communal bank because all its members are responsible people and are very united. She thanks those people who will be managers of the loan she is requesting, and it will be very useful to her in the progress of her business. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy potato seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
María de 42 años, tiene un centro medico, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Ella estudio enfermería y como vio la necesidad de un dispensario de salud comenzó a readecuar un lugar para atender a las personas de el sector donde vive. Trabaja todas las tarde atendiendo a las personas. Para obtener mas dinero ella y así solventar los gastos de la clínica de salud tiene una pequeña tienda que la atiende su hija. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar medicinas, productos para la tienda como enlatados, granos. En el futuro quiere tener ya un establecimiento medico bien construido y así ayudar a mas gente.
texts.en:
Maria is 42 years old and has a medical clinic. She lives in a zone called Duran on the fringe of the city, a location known for its deteriorating ecology. Maria studied nursing and, seeing the need for a health dispensary, she began to develop a place where she could attend to people from the sector where she lives. Maria works every afternoon, caring for clients. To obtain more money, and thus cover the costs of the health clinic, she has a small store that her daughter runs. With this loan Maria wants to buy medicines for her clinic and products for the store, such as canned goods and grains. In the future she wants to have an well-constructed medical establishment, in order to help more people.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MEDICATIONS FOR HER CLINIC AND CANNED GOODS FOR THE STORE THAT SUPPORTS IT

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is part of the communal bank “Vida Nueva” (New life) and resides in the commune of Longaví. For the past five years, Nelfa has sold firewood and charcoal with her husband's help. Prior to this business, Nelfa operated a restaurant for 15 years from her house, the same space she now uses for her merchandise sales. 

With this loan, Nelfa plans to purchase more firewood and charcoal. Nelfa's dreams are to operate a grocery store, selling confections, fruit and vegetables. Her short-term goal is to fix her storefront, as it was damaged by the past earthquake on February 27. 

For Nelfa, the loan services provided by Kiva partner Fondo Esperanza have helped to keep her business afloat; she especially enjoys the lessons on business administration. 
  
Longaví is a commune in the Maule Region, central Chile. Its name in Mapudungun (the Mapuche language) stands for “snake head.” It's primarily a farming community situated between mountains, foothills and more mountains of lush natural beauty. Its highest point is Mount Longaví, with 3,242 meters of altitude.

loans.use: Firewood and charcoal

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.es: Cleopatra tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 1 año posee una librería, negocio que tiene instalado en su mismo domicilio. Desde entonces atiende todos los días, además procura que éste bien implementado su negocio con variedades de productos y artículos de oficina y escolar. Par ella este actividad le ha resultado muy rentable, puesto que la zona donde vive no hay un negocio de este rubro. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes atienden a la clientela que son varios los que acuden en el establecimiento. En todo este tiempo ha visto como su negocio se ha establecido y eso la anima a seguir trabajando y plantearse nuevos proyectos, como el de ampliar más el espacio de su librería e implementarlo de más productos. Este es su crédito número 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, afirma además que le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Asimismo agradece  a todas las personas que son gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en útiles de escritorio como papeles metálicos y otra calidad de papel.
texts.en: Cleopatra is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in their own house. For a year, she has owned a book store, which is located in her home. She works there every day and it is stocked with a variety of school and office supplies. This has been very profitable for her, since it is located in an area where there are not other businesses of this type. At times, her children help her; they work with the various customers who come to the store. During all this time, she has seen how her business has become established. This encourages her to continue working and to plan new projects, like increasing the size of her store and adding more products. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very pleased to know she has financial support. She also states that she is grateful to be a part of her community bank because all of the members are very supportive and responsible. She is also grateful for those who help to provide this loan; it will be very useful in her business’ progress. With this loan, she will invest in the purchase of more desk items and accessories like foil paper and other types of paper.

loans.use: to buy more products like foil paper and other types of paper

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose D. is currently in the business of selling beans, fish, simsim and millet along Maridi road. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of millet and beans to sell. Rose is 30 years old and is married to a mechanic. She has 4 children; 2 of which go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a new type of business of selling clothes.

loans.use: To stock more bags of millet and beans to sell

loans.name: Aysel

texts.ru:
Aysel A. 20 let. Ona ne zamujem i jivet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Aysel uchitsya v kolledje i v toje vremya rabotayet chtobi oplatit uchebu.

Aysel uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya prodajey produktov. Aysel etomu biznessu nauchilas u teti. Ona prodayet pishiviye produkti , no seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit moyushiye sredstva dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Aysel A. is 20 years old. She is not married and lives in the Absheron region together with her family. Aysel is studying in college and at the same time works to pay for her tuition.

Aysel has been selling food for more than two years. She has learned this business from her aunt. She sells groceries and now needs 2000 AZN to buy cleaning products for resale and expansion of her business.

loans.use: To buy products for resale

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 42 years old and in business. He operates a transport business in Kiambu, where he transports goods for people for a fee. His main customers are the residents of the town. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kes to repair his vehicle. Eliud is a member of Bidii Umoja SHG and the group has guaranteed his loan. 

Eliud also practices dairy farming for extra income. He is married and a father to three children who are in school. His hopes are to excel in the transport business and have a fleet of lorries.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora  Rosa María López Madriz, cuenta con 40 años de edad, casada desde hace 24 años con el señor Francisco que se dedica a la albañilería, ellos tienen 5 hijos, Erika de 22 años, Cristian de 20 años, Pablo que tiene 16 años quien le ayuda con los gastos de la casa, Dulce María de 8 años de edad y Francisco de 6 años ambos estudiantes de primaria, ella es originaria de la localidad de San Jose Purua ubicado en el estado de Michoacán. Doña Rosa pidió su préstamo para invertir en su taller de costura como son hilos, telas, estambres, pinturas para tela, pinceles, sierres etc. Ella hace bolsas, bordados en servilletas, punto de cruz en servilletas y almohadones, blusas de manta, después las decora con dibujos y las colorea. Doña Rosa vende las costuras con sus conocidas, lleva con su negocio hace 5 meses, comenta que le satisface su trabajo, sus clientas dicen que es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, sus metas en la vida es sacar a sus hijos adelante que sigan estudiando, y comenta que en un futuro quisiera tener un negocio fijo y con sus ganancias podrá comprarle a sus hijos útiles escolares y los uniformes para el nuevo ciclo escolar y los medicamentos de su suegra.
texts.en: Rosa Maria L. Madriz is 40 years old, and she has been married with Francisco, a construction worker, for 24 years. they have 5 children, Erika who is 22 years old, Cristian is 20 years old, Pablo is 16 years old and he contributes to the household finances, Dulce Maria is 8 years old, and Francisco is 6 years old. The two youngest are in primary school. She is originally from San Jose Purua which is located in the state of Michoacan. Rosa requested this loan to invest in her tailoring shop by purchasing threads, fabrics, yarns, fabric paints, paint brushes, zippers etc. She makes purses, decorated handkerchiefs, decorative pillows, and linen blouses. She decorates and colors the items prior to resale. Rosa sells her products to her acquaintances, a business she has had for the past 5 months. She is very happy with the business. Her clients say that she is a very hardworking and enterprising person with a great will to come out ahead. Her goal in life is to keep her kids in school. In the future she would like to have a steady business from where she will be able to provide her kids with the school supplies and uniforms they need. She also wants to buy medicine for her mother-in-law.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabrics.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos en el distrito D. Wanchaq. El distrito D. Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en L. provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito D. las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos D. L. plaza D. armas D. L. capital arqueológica D. América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos D. los Incas, L. ciudad del Cusco está construida en L. base D. L. antigua ciudadeL. Inca.

Carlos tiene un pequeño taller D. automotriz donD. brinda servicios D. mantenimiento D. carros, él en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicios D. transporte públicos en su propio taxi. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios D. transportes y le va regular. Con su próximo préstamo, Carlos que espera recibir S/.800 nuevos soles es para comprar materiales para el taller como por ejemplo aceites D. carros, lubricantes, etc.

Carlos pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” D. L. Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año D. funcionamiento y está bien administrado por L. junta directiva.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his partner and two children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  It is called "The Flower District" and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza D. Armas, in the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is an enchanting city which dates back to Inca times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Carlos has a small auto repair shop where he provides a car repair service.  In his free time he provides public transport services in his own taxi.  He has been providing public transport services for several years and his business is doing ok.  He hopes to receive a loan for 800 Peruvian soles to buy materials for his auto repair shop such as, for example, car oil, lubricants, etc.

Carlos is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and well run by a board of directors.

loans.use: To buy materials for his auto repair shop such as car oil, lubricants, etc.

loans.name: Ken

texts.en:
Ken K., 43, is a widowed farmer who lives her two daughters. Living in the Takeo province, she typically makes $1 every day and is aided by her daughters, who work in a garment factory. 

Ken K. is asking for a loan of $1,200 to finish her construction and purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and finish construction

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia pertenece al Banco comunal “Amigo”, perteneciente a la comuna de Recoleta. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de uniformes escolares hace 17 años y desde  hace 3 años tiene un taller que acomodó en el patio de su casa. Su familia le ayuda en el corte y confección de los uniformes escolares; su hija borda y su marido después de su trabajo le ayuda a cortar las telas. 
Tiene como clientes frecuentes a 2 colegios, a los cuales entrega uniformes escolares (faldas, pantalones, buzos), durante el periodo de noviembre a abril. Además Sonia tiene clientes particulares, a los que les confecciona buzos y parkas en temporada de invierno.
Con este préstamo, Sonia comprará telas y cuellos para poleras. 
Su sueño es aumentar el número de clientes; es decir incluir como un cliente frecuente a un colegio más y también aumentar sus clientes particulares, de esta manera aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos. Sumado a esto ser reconocida.
Para Sonia los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido fundamentales en su negocio, ya que le han permitido financiar y aumentar su producción. Gracias a los ingresos de su negocio Sonia ha podido financiar  los estudios superiores de su hija.
Recoleta es una de las 34 comunas de Santiago (capital de Chile) y se encuentra ubicada en el sector centro-norte del Santiago, región metropolitana. Cuenta con un activo comercio, destacando el barrio comercial de Patronato que ha acogido principalmente a comerciantes árabes (en un principio) y coreanos (en la actualidad).
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Amigo” communal bank in Recoleta.  She has been manufacturing and selling school uniforms for the past 17 years.  For the past three years she’s had a workshop installed in her patio.  Her family helps her cut and assemble the school uniforms; her daughter embroiders and her husband helps her cut after he gets home from work.

Two schools are her frequent buyers.  She delivers school uniforms to them (skirts, pants and sweatshirts) from November through April.  Sonia also has individual customers for whom she makes sweatshirts and parkas for winter.  With this loan Sonia will buy fabric and collars for t-shirts.

Her dream is to increase her number of customers; in other words, include an additional school as a regular customer as well as increase her individual customers so that production will increase and thus her profits as well.  And in addition to this, she wants to be well known.

For Sonia, loans from Fondo Esperanza have been fundamental for her business because they have made it possible to finance and increase production.  Thanks to income from her business Sonia has been able to pay for her daughter’s higher education.

Recoleta is one of the 34 communes in Santiago (capital of Chile) and is located in the north-central part of Santiago’s metropolitan area.  It has active commerce, a notable neighborhood being Patronato which has welcomed principally Arab merchants (at the beginning) and Koreans (now).

loans.use: For fabric and shirt collars.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem S., 31, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Sem is a hairdresser, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a mechanic, earning an income of USD 4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 32 on other necessary expenses.

Sem is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more car spare parts for her husband to improve his business. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy more car spare parts for her husband to improve his business

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
Khursheed resides in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called Kot Radha Kishen. Kot Radha Kishen is known for its dairy industry. She owns a three-room house there in the area of the Ghandian Road and has been living there with her family for the past 18 years.

She is married to A. R. who has a business selling engine oil. He buys the engine oil from different companies and sells to different shops and customers. He has been doing this business for the past 10 years and has a good reputation among his customers.

Khursheed has given birth to 2 sons and 2 daughters. Her sons work in a factory for a low income while her daughters stay at home and help her finish the household chores. Khursheed couldn’t educate them due to poor financial circumstances.

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy engine oil to resell. This will help him make more sales and earn more profits.

Khursheed is hopeful that after investing the loan money into his business, her husband will be able to improve his business. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her third loan application. She is a responsible loan user and always maintained a good credit behavior with every loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (an Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for selling

loans.name: Carmen Isabel

texts.es:
La Señorita Carmen M. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Solidarias, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca pero es oriunda de la comunidad de Chican en el cantón Paute, este cantón es de clima templado propicio para la siembra de flores, es conocido por la belleza de sus paisajes, su gente se dedica al comercio, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Carmen tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera y vive independiente, trabaja como empleada domestica hace 5 meses, labora de lunes a viernes todo el día y los días sábados estudia en un colegio de la ciudad.

Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su mamá quien es una socia activa, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos para criar en su casa. Su meta es culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Srta. Carmen M. is a member of the Communal Bank “Mujeres Solidarias” (Supportive Women). She lives in the city of Cuenca, but she is originally from the community of Chican in Paute Canton. This canton has a temperate climate that is suitable for growing flowers. In addition, Paute is known for its beautiful landscapes. The people engage in trade, livestock breeding, and agriculture.

Carmen is 18 years old, single, and lives independently. She has worked as a domestic employee for the past five months. Carmen works all day Monday through Friday. On Saturdays she studies at a college in the city.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after she was invited to join by her mother, who is an active member. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens to raise at home. Her goal is to finish her studies.

loans.use: To purchase chickens.

loans.name: Salkynai's Group

texts.en:
Salkynai J., 29, is the leader of this group and a resident of the town of Nookat. Her husband is a construction worker and they have a young son and a daughter. Salkynai is busy selling groceries in a local market and remembers her start when she had only 3,000 KGS to invest. At this moment she is doubling the capital and receives a profit of about $108 monthly. The purpose of the loan is to purchase more goods and increase her working capital. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to resell

loans.name: Helena Veronica

texts.pt:
Helena Veronica M. nasceu na cidade de Xai Xai, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 7 filhos de idades entre 08 a 38 anos, os mais novos ainda  continuam a estudar. Frequenta 10ª classe não continuou quando jovem  devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para alem de seus filhos.

Saiu de Gaza para  Maputo ainda muito jovem com seus pais, depois de se casar mudou se para Boane com a sua familia. Tem um negocio proprio de venda de loiça de cozinha ha mais de 10 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 3.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte na sua conta bancaria porque tem ajuda do seu marido que trabalha na Eletricidade de Moçambique.

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua vizinha que é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar mercadoria (pratos, copos, talheres, panelas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar a sua banca.
texts.en:
Helena Veronica M. was born in the city of Xai Xai, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and the mother of 7 children between the ages of 8 and 38. The youngest children are still in school. Helena attends 10th grade. She did not finish school when she was young because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone other than her children.

When she was still very young, she left Gaza to move to Maputo with her parents. After marrying, she moved to Boane with her family. For more than 10 years Helena has had her own business selling kitchen ware. She has no employees and has a monthly income of about 3,500 meticais. She uses this money for household expenses and manages to save some in her bank account because her husband, who works at the utilities company Eletricidade de Moçambique, helps her.

She has never had loans from other banks, and she learned about Hluvuku through her neighbor, who is a customer of this institution. This is Helena's first Hluvuku loan, and she is asking for 20,000 meticais. She intends to buy merchandise (plates, glasses, flatware, pans and other items) to increase her stock.

She promises to pay on time so she can take out other loans in the future. She plans to ask for new loans so she can expand her sales stand.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (plates, glasses, flatware, pans, etc.)

loans.name: Danitza Yovani

texts.es:
Danitza es una madre de familia de 28 años dedad que vive con su esposo y menores hijos en el distrito de Ferreqafe a  tan solo 30 minutos de distancia de la provincia de chiclayo, cuenta con una casa propia, con servicios de agua y luz ubicada en la zona rural de dicho distrito. Ferreqafe se caracteriza por ser unazona netamnente agricola y ganadera.

Danitza se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y es conocida por su vecinos porque ofrece sus productos de casa en casa.  Estos productos es para que las personas mejoren su imagen perosnal, en especial las mujeres y con esos ingresos se ayuda para sacar adelante a sus hijos y ayudar a su esposo económicamente.

A solicitado Danitza a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para mejorar el baño de su casa,y  mejorar la higiene y limpieza para su familia evitando todo riesgo de contraer alguna enfermedad.  Con los ingresos de la venta de sus productos de belleza cubriría las cuotas del crédito brindado.

Danitza es una persona muy conocidad por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable y una buena madre al querer brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Danitza is a 28-year old mother who lives together with her husband and her young children in the district of Ferreqafe. It is located only 30 minutes from the province of Chiclayo. She owns her home and it is equipped with water and hydro, and it is situated in the rural region of the district. Ferreqafe is a strictly agricultural and farming region.

Danitza sells beauty products and she is well known to her neighbors because she sells her products form house to house. These products are used by individuals to improve their personal appearance, especially women. With her profits she is able to help support her children and she can help her husband financially.

Danitza has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) to improve the bathroom in her house for better hygiene and cleanliness for her family. She wants to avoid any risk of contracting a disease. She will be able to cover the payments of her loan with the profits from the sale of her beauty products.

Danitza is a very well known to be a hardworking person who is responsible and who is a good mother. She wants to provide her children with a better future and to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to improve the bathroom in her home.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Estrella works hard to support her family. She has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling food. 

Estrella is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell for her business. Estrella has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
Melva is 40 years of age and married with four children. She owns a business selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap. and toothpaste.  She has three years of experience in this business. Melva needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional stocks for her store. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 120 talas or US $50 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In 2011, Melva joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Melva's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her store

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 47 years old, married to Jacob and supports a family of three children. She has run a retail shop for the last seven years.

With her first loan of 10,000 KES from KADET Ltd., she wants to purchase additional stock like tea leaves and washing detergents to sell. 

The anticipated profit will enable her to repay and expand her business.  Her future dreams are to have a wholesale shop and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: El señor Raúl trabaja  como albañil en distintos lugares en forma independiente; el realiza contratos cada semana. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (cemento, arena, fierro) ya que realizara el levantamiento de columnas para construir habitaciones. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Rió Seco  de la ciudad de El Alto; es separado y tiene cinco hijos. Raúl es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2006.
texts.en:
Raúl is self-employed as a builder and he works in different places, carrying out contracts every week.  He needs this loan to buy construction supplies (cement, sand and iron) so that he can erect pillars for building rooms. 

Raúl lives in his own home in Rió Seco district, in the city of El Alto.  He is separated and has five children.  Raúl has been a client of IMPRO since 2006.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and iron to erect pillars for building rooms

loans.name: Luz Del Día Group

texts.es:
El grupo Luz del Día lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora Margarita de los Ángeles  de 47años comerciante de productos Avon, empresa reconocida por sus ventas vía catálogo. Además de este negocio con los préstamos puso una pequeña venta en la que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mercadería como granos básicos, chiverias, carne, huevo, pan...etc.
Los otros integrantes son José de 28 años propietario de un autolavado el cual inicio hace 5 años y Healy quien tiene un tramo en el mercado donde vende CD y chinelas, y por las tardes en su casa tiene una fritanga, realiza sopa y riega mercadería.
texts.en:
The “Luz del Día” (Light of Day) Communal Bank is comprised of three hard-working people.

Margarita de los Ángeles, age 47, is one of them.  She sells Avon products.  Avon is a company that is known for its catalog sales.  In addition to this business, she has used the loans to set up a small sales business.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise for this business, such as basic grains, snacks, meat, eggs, bread, etc.  

José, age 28, is also a member.  He has a car wash that he started five years ago.  The other member, Healy, has a vending station in the market where she sells CDs and slippers.  In the afternoons she sells fried food at her house, makes soup, and displays her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Peang

texts.en:
Mrs. Peang, 53, and her husband, 54, are always thinking about the strategy to success in their life. To develop the family in prosperity, Mrs. Peang works as a farmer. In addition, she takes time out of her farming business to sell fish in her village and other villages. She earns $3 per day. Her husband is the director of the family. All the people know him as a construction worker in the village. He earns an income of $6 per day. To improve the family in honor, Mrs. Peang wishes to borrow some funds to support her farming business. She would like to request $1,100 to purchase land.

She appears in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: To purchase land.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Paz has a shop that sells snacks like rice cakes, cassava cakes & hot cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy raw materials needed for making snacks.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Murodkul

texts.ru:
Муродкул женат и отец 2 детей. Он целеустремленный и честный человек. Муродкул любит свою семью и всегда старается обеспечить их всеми необходимыми вещами. Он занимается купля продажей материалы, детские и женские одежды, а также арбузы, морковь и лука. Муродкул хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль с целью улучшение жилищное условие. Он хотел бы получит займ в размере 1100$ США для покупки школьных униформ. Он заранее благодарит вас всех за вашу помощь и доброты. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en: Murodkul is married and a father of two children.  He is a goal-oriented and honest person.  Murodkul loves his family and always tries to provide them with all the necessary things.  He is involved in buying and selling of materials, children's and women's clothing and also watermelons, carrots and onions.  Murodkul wants to expand his business ad maximize his profits in order to improve his living conditions.  He wants to obtain a loan in the sum of $1100 for the purchase of school uniforms.  He thanks all of you in advance for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase school uniforms

loans.name: Muniratu

texts.en: Muniratu is married and has four children. She cooks banku and rice balls at Elmina, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a security man. She uses the revenue she generates from her business to assist her husband to take care of the home. Muniratu will use the loan to procure bags of maize and rice to cook to sell. Muniratu plans to plow back the new profits from her stretched business for further growth.

loans.use: to procure bags of maize and rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for rice farming.

loans.name: Ximena Paola

texts.es: La señora  Ximena  tiene la actividad de venta de ropa ella es ambulante generalmente sus ventas se concentran en distintas oficinas de la zona central, ella  también recibe la ayuda de la hermana que trabaja como asalariada con el cargo en una oficina del centro, y es ahí donde ofrece sus productos, tiene ya mucha clientela, la cliente vive con su hermana en la casa  de sus padres y de esta manera cuida la casa, ya que sus  padres se encuentran viviendo en Cochabamba por motivos de salud,  con el dinero del  crédito comprara mercadería por mayor ropa ya que tienen muchos pedidos,  Lo mas resaltante de esta actividad es que ella hace que sus clientes elijan los productos que desean y no así como hacen otras personas que primero compran los productos antes de ofrecerlos, haciendo que el  cliente se encuentre satisfecho por la compra.
texts.en:
Ximena has an door-to-door clothing sales business. Her sales are generally concentrated in various offices around the downtown area. She gets help from her sister who is a salaried employee at an office in the city center. That is where she offers her products. She has a large clientele.

She lives with her sister in her parent's house and in this way takes care of the home, since her parents live in Cochabamba for health reasons. With the money from this loan she will buy wholesale merchandise as she has many orders. The most outstanding aspect of this business is that she allows her customers to choose the products they want unlike others who purchase the products ahead of time. This makes her customers very satisfied with their purchases.

loans.use: to purchase pre-ordered clothing.

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
Suos is hard working at the construction field. He has been working as a construction worker for long time in the Kompong Chhnang province. From his business, he typically earns an average of $2.5USD per day to cover the family’s needs. Suos is married with three single children who live under his care. 

Due to the lack of construction materials, Suos faces difficulties in his work. Therefore, he would like to request a loan from Kiva and HKL to purchase construction supplies in the sum of KHR 800,000. With the increase in income, Mr. Suos hopes to provide his children opportunities to be educated in a university.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Ever Orlando

texts.es:
el sr. Ever tiene 26 años de edad, esta soltero y se dedica a la venta de relojes, tiene una experiencia de 6 años en la venta de relojes, su negocio está ubicado en un punto estratégico, se encuentra cerca de la terminal de buses, por este lugar transitan muchas personas de diferentes aldeas y caserios, mismas que le compran los relojes a Ever.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de relojes para dama y caballero, brazaletes de repuesto y pines.
así tendra variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ever is 26 years old, single, and his business is selling watches.  He has 6 years experience selling watches.  His business is located in a strategic location, near the bus station.  Many people from different villages and hamlets pass through this place and buy watches from Ever.  

Ever will use his loan to buy men's and ladies' watches, replacement straps and pins.  This means he will have a variety to offer his customers.

loans.use: to buy watches, replacement straps and pins

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Barbara” del centro poblado de Chinumani, distrito, provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene  19  años de edad, es soltera y estudió hasta la secundaria.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un ciclo, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, fideos, huevo, aceite, etc. Ella trabaja junto con su papá y su mercadería la vende en Juliaca.

Su sueño es seguir adelante con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  es la reunión porque comparte con las socias, además le gusta la puntualidad y el ahorro.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of the Santa Bárbara communal bank in the community of Chinumani, district and province of Yunguyo, department of Puno.  She is 19 years old and single, and studied to high school.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for one loan cycle.  Her first loan was for the sum of 500 PEN, money that she invested in her grocery store business.

With this current loan of 1,000 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, vermicelli, eggs, oil, etc.  She works along with her father and she sells her merchandise in Juliaca.

Her dream is to get ahead with her business and improve her earnings.

What Gloria likes most about her communal bank are the meetings, because she shares with the members.  She also likes the punctuality and savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, vermicelli, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna, a 53-year-old married mother of 10, lives in the Philippines where she has been operating a shop selling canned goods, snacks and beverages for 10 years now. A member of HSPFI since 2011, Edna is requesting a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages, and in the future hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii SHG Group in Western Kenya! Elizabeth is the facilitator of Bidii SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best training facilities in farming offered by the firm and also to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had a good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: El Carrizo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama el Carrizo está conformado por  once  integrantes indígenas con deseos de superarse y darle una mejor vida a sus familias.
Sus integrantes decidieron ponerle El CARRIZO a su grupo por que se identifican con su localidad sus culturas y sus tradiciones.
Las integrantes son cuentan que están muy  orgullosas una de la otra ya que juntas se siente seguras para realizar sus sueños y apoyarse una de la otra  que sus negocios crezcan cada día mas.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Claudia de cincuenta años de edad, es una señora responsable trabajadora y llena de fuerzas para apoyar a sus compañeras y a su familia.
Doña Clau como le dicen sus compañeras de grupo se dedica a la venta de mercancía de abarrotes desde hace cinco años.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que más le gusta de su negocio es tener limpia su tienda para que de un buen aspecto y también nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de quesos ya que su esposo Julián  va ordeñar y cada lunes, miércoles y viernes se dedica a la venta de quesos.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más mercancía de abarrotes como son: chiles secos y chiles verdes, jitomate, galletas, aceite, jugos, refrescos, sabritas, dulces y pan.
Está muy contenta y agradecida con fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante  a ella y a sus compañeras ya que todas son mujeres trabajadoras, humildes con ganas de triunfar en la vida.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Leovigilda– se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Dominga- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Adelfa- se dedica a la venta de frutas y legumbres.
Fidelfa – se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Rosa- se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos.
Margarita- se dedica a la venta de pan.
Ángela   Micaela - se dedica a la venta de postres.
Sofía- se dedica a la venta de pescado.
Elena- se dedica a la venta de refrescos.
María del Carmen – se dedica a la venta de pollos.
Bernabé- se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes.

Gracias fundación por ayudar a la gente humilde y mixteca que tiene sueños por cumplir y gracias  por ayudarnos.
texts.en:
This group is called “Carrizo” and is made up of eleven members with a desire to get ahead and provide better lives for their families.  They decided to call the group “El Carrizo” because they identified with their area, its culture, and traditions.

The members are very proud of one another, since they feel certain to be able to achieve their dreams together and support one another in their businesses.  They grow more each day.

Claudia is one of the members.  She’s 50 years old, and is a very hardworking responsible lady full of energy to support her fellow members and her family.

Ms. Clau, as her fellow members refer to her, has been selling groceries for five years.  

She says that what she likes most about her business is keeping her store clean in order to give a good impression.  She also says that she sells cheeses.  Her husband, Julián, milks the cows, and she sells cheese on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

She requested this loan to buy more groceries, such as dried peppers, green peppers, tomatoes, cookies, cooking oil, juices, soft drinks, potato chips, candy, and bread.  She is very happy and grateful to the foundation for the support it’s given her and her colleagues, because they’re all hardworking, humble women with a desire to get ahead in life. 

The other members of the group are:

Leovigilda – sells Mexican food
Dominga – sells Mexican food
Adelfa – sells fruits and vegetables
Fidelfa – sells Mexican food
Rosa – sells Mexican food
Margarita – sells bread
Ángela Micaela – sells desserts
Sofía – sells fish
Elena – sells soft drinks
María del Carmen – sells chickens
Bernabé – sells groceries

Thank you for helping for helping the humble, diverse people with dreams to fulfill.  Thanks for helping us.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 7 children. 
Alicia has a shop that sells food seasonings, spices & vegetables. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy food seasonings, spices & vegetables to sell.
Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alicia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy food seasonings, spices & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en: Sarom, 41, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a garment worker and a rice farmer. Her husband is a policeman. One of her children is employed at the garment factory. Sarom is requesting a loan of USD 850 to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season. By doing so, she can earn extra income to support her family. In the future, she would like to renovate her house and send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seed and fertilizer to grow rice in the dry season

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself as honest, intelligent and obedient. He operates a motorcycle providing transportation. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located at a resiential area and his primary customers are residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of fuel. 

Paul will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to his savings and buy another motorbike. Paul's business goal is to own many motorbikes within five years.

loans.use: To add to his savings and buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Abdallha

texts.en: Abdullah is a sixty year old married man living in Masindi, Uganda. He sells packed water and with the proceeds he has been able to buy land and pay school fees for his children. High costs of operation and inadequate capital hinder his business profits. His dream is to own a big water factory. Abdullah intends to use the loan to buy water packaging materials to use.

loans.use: to buy water packaging materials to use.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as reliable. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add to his savings and buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Beli

texts.en: Beli is a married man his wife is Olga and the couple have their own house and they have 5 kids to feed Beli sells milk and he makes cheese he is assisted by his wife and sometimes he is a mason Beli needs a loan to buy a milking cow Beli goes to many fairs to offer his cheese so he hopes you can help him

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: "There is a positive difference in my life," explained Mrs Josephine I.. She is married with five children and lives in a semi-rural area of Edo State. She provides the service of hairdressing for the community. She needs the amount to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business

loans.name: Parwana

texts.en:
Parwana, D/O G. H., is single and lives in District 7 of Kabul City. During the war she emigrated to Iran with her family where she was unable to study and started to assist her family by starting a business. At first she started a tailoring business in Iran, but after the Taliban government fell she returned to Afghanistan and started a knitting business.

The start of her business was very poor because she had less material to work with and also she didn't know the exact demand of market. After hearing about the loan process she decided to start taking loans. She is at her first loan cycle and through loan amount she has purchased more materials to make better quality goods which have a big demand in the market. She is happy with the loan process and wants to continue with it.

loans.use: Buying more materials

loans.name: Maria Vilma

texts.en:
Mi name is Maria Vilma G. and I produce and sell donuts. I have had my business for two years. My goal is to increment my inventory to producer more donuts and increase my earnings in order to remodel my oven (enlarge it) . Donut demand is very good because most of the tourists that come to our community buy lots of donuts. I also want to be able to cover my home's food expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Maria Vilma G. me dedico a la produccion y venta de rosquillas tengo mi negocio hace 2 años, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener una mayor produccion de rosquillas y tener mayores ganancias ya que deseo remodelar mi horno (hacerlo mas grande) porque la demanda es buena ya que la mayoria de los turistas que vienen a nuestra comunidad compran muchas rosquillas, asi mismo cubrir con los gastos alimenticios de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase cheese, flour, salt, oil, butter, margarine

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina has a small grocery stand where she sells non-perishable foods at a busy market in Mukachevo, Ukraine. In business for two years, she makes about $200 a month in profit – an important source of income for her and husband and their two children. Katerina’s business is a good example of the opportunities available for Ukrainian entrepreneurs who are willing to work hard and take a risk to start a market business.

Katerina has requested a loan of $800 to help purchase a new supply of grocery items to sell at her stand. One of Katerina’s desires for the future is to have another child. We hope that her business continues to do well and provides the necessary income to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Gamar

texts.en: Gamar is 44 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz in Azerbaijan. She is married and has 2 children. Gamar has been in the poultry business for 6 years, buying and selling poultry. She needs a loan of $775 to buy more chicken for her poultry business.

loans.use: To buy chicken

loans.name: Ousmak

texts.en:
Mrs. M. Ousamak is 37 years old and her husband, Mr. Kob Mat, is 34 years old. The couple got married in 1996 and have four children, 3 of whom still live at home while the youngest is still in school. The family has been raising ducks for fifteen years. Beside helping her raise ducks, her husband also sells fish for sale in the village.

Mrs M. is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA of $800. She plans to use the loan to purchase baby ducks and duck feed.

loans.use: Purchasing 200 baby ducks

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Isabel is 30 years old and currently lives in the Lamas district of Lamas, San Martín. She is a single mother and has one seven-year-old son. Mrs. Ana used to devote herself to selling fruit-flavored lollipops to cover the economic needs of her household. Later she decided to get involved in selling groceries, but she didn’t have enough money to expand her business before she joined the “Ciudad de los Tres Pisos” communal bank. With her first loan for S./300.00, she was able to buy a wider variety of products to stock her grocery store. Later, with her earnings and other loans she received from her communal bank, she bought rice, sugar, milk, noodles, vegetables, crackers, etc, and now she owns a variety store in her own home. With this loan of $525 which she will pay in 6 months, she will buy dozens of different brands and flavors of soft drinks, rice, 50 kg bags of sugar, packets of noodles, oil, boxes of soap, stews of different flavors, and so on, to offer to her demanding clientele. Her dream is to one day open a wholesale grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Ana Isabel tiene 30 años de edad, actualmente vive en el distrito de Lamas, provincia de Lamas, departamento de San Martín, tiene un hijo de siete años, es madre soltera. La señora Ana se dedicaba a la venta de chupetes de fruta para poder cubrir las necesidades económicas que tiene en el hogar, después decidió incorporarse en el negocio de los abarrotes, pero el capital que tenia no era suficiente para incrementar su negocio antes de pertenecer al banco comunal “ciudad de los 3 pisos”. Con el primer préstamo de S/: 300.00, pudo comprar mayor cantidad de productos para surtir la venta de abarrotes y posteriormente con las ganancias y con los otros préstamos que recibe en su Banco Comunal compró arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, verduras, galletas, etc. y ahora posee un negocio con variedad, dentro de su propia casa. Con el préstamo de S/. 1500.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará gaseosas en docenas en su diversas marcas y sabores, arroz, azúcar en sacos de 50 kilos, fideos en paquetes, aceite y jabones en cajas, menestras en diferentes variedades y sacos, etc. para ofertar a su exigente clientela. Sueña con abrir una tienda mayorista de abarrotes.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries - rice, sugar, noodles, soaps, stews, etc - for sale in her store

loans.name: Angela Isabel

texts.es:
Angela Isabel, or "Angelita" as her friends call her, has a business selling every day grocery items such as oil, soap, detergents, shampoo, etc. She has 3 children whom she must take care of and educate. She began her business 8 years ago in the Leon station market, with money she received as a loan. After buying the first products, she began to aggressively sell them, working hard to clear her debt. She needs to invest in more stock for her business, and Ceprodel has helped her with 11 credits which she has invested to grow her business and continue to support her home.

Angela Isabel conocida comúnmente como angelita se dedica a vender productos de abarrotaría como aceite, jabón, pastes, detergentes, escobas, shampoo, etc.)

Posee tres hijos que tiene el deber de educar y brindar protección y alimentación. Su negocio da inicio desde hace 8 años en el mercado la Estación de León, con una inversión de $500 (Quinientos dólares netos) que los obtuvo por medio de un préstamo a un prestamista. Una vez que compró los primeros productos, muy esforzadamente los comercializó y busco la manera de cómo salir de esta deuda hasta acabarla.

Una necesidad que posee angelita es que necesita invertir en la compra de los abarrotes y por esta razón es que acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con créditos (Actualmente 11 créditos a su favos)que los invierte directamente en su negocio y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su hogar que tanto lo necesita.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MORE STOCK FOR HER BUSINESS, SUCH AS OIL, SOAP, DETERGENT, SHAMPOO, ETC.  HER BUSINESS ALLOWS HER TO CARE FOR AND EDUCATE HER THREE CHILDREN.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs. Hong H., 30, works growing vegetables and rice crops, earning about $1 each day from selling her vegetables to a nearby market. Her husband is a soldier and spends the rest of his time helping to cultivate the crops. This couple has two little children; one is too young to attend school and the other is a primary school student. Mrs. Hong H. would like to increase her family’s income by increasing her outputs. Regrettably, her piece of farmland is too small to grow additional crops. After hearing about CREDIT MFI from one of her neighbors, she made a quick decision to ask for a loan of $500 to purchase another piece of farmland to use for her crop expansion. This will bring her and her family a better life.

loans.use: to purchase another piece of land to grow crops

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Mrs. Hout H., age 50, works as a dealer purchasing chili and dry fish, making on average $2 a day. Her husband, Mr. Pum Phun, age 52, is an army doctor with a salary $50 a month. They have 5 children.

Two of their children are teachers with a salary $80 each per month and their other children help their mother with the housework.

She would like to borrow $500 to increase the amount of chili and dry fish she can buy in bulk and resell. She will use the rest of money to raise pigs. (Picture: husband and wife)

loans.use: To purchase chili and dry fish and raise pigs

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.es:
Vanessa is a single mother of a boy of two years. She began working selling delicacies on foot in a market. At present, she cooks for workers of a school that is located next to her house and at an institute where she once studied. At first she only cooked for a few people, but later she became known and each time more people requested her services. Nowadays, aside from selling her food to order, she works preparing buffets for some events with a group of friends. On the other hand, always with the objective to be able to give her son everything that he needs, on Sundays she prepares tamales (a Peruvian dish made from crushed corn) to sell them in the mornings.

In the future, she plans to have a shoe store, since her mother was dedicated to shoe sales from her youth and succeeded very well.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Vanessa es madre soltera de un niño de dos años. Ella empezó trabajando vendiendo golosinas como ambulante en un mercado. Actualmente, ella cocina para trabajadores de un colegio que se ubica frente a su casa y de un instituto donde ella estudio alguna vez. Al inicio, solo cocinaba para pocas personas, pero luego se fue haciendo conocida y cada vez más personas solicitaban su servicio. Hoy en día, aparte de vender su comida a pedido, trabaja preparando buffets para algunos eventos con un grupo de amigas. Por otro lado, siempre con el objetivo de poder darle a su hijo todo lo que necesita, los domingos prepara tamales (plato peruano hecho a base de maíz molido) para venderlos en las mañanas

En un futuro, ella planea tener una tienda de zapatos, pues su mamá de joven se dedicaba a eso y le iba muy bien.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina has a successful small business selling sports apparel at a large market in Ivano-Frankivsk, Ukraine. Married, with two young sons ages 10 and 11, Marina works hard to help provide for her family. She decided to start her own business about six years ago. She now has two selling locations at the market and has hired one person to help her with sales.

With the busy summer season approaching, Marina has requested a short term loan to help purchase a new supply of t-shirts to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase supply of t-shirts to sell

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
Mr. Mamadou C. is a shopkeeper who was born on 19 November 1965 in THIES. He is married and has two children. He has benefited from two previous loans, which he repaid on time. It is with the aim of improving his profit margin that he is requesting this loan to buy merchandise in bulk to resell to his customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

M. Mamadou C. est un commerçant qui est né le 19/11/1965 à THIES.il est marié et est père de deux enfants .il a eu à bénéficier de deux crédits qu'il a remboursé correctement.c'est dans le but d'améliorer sa marge bénéficiaire qu'il sollicite ce pret pour acheter des marchandises en quantité pour les revendre à ses clients.

loans.use: To increase his stock of merchandise

loans.name: Thi Khiem's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. N. Thi Khiem (ID Number 03070006), born in 1974, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell. She has 2 school-going children. Everyday she sells fruits and vegetables in the market whiL. her husband works as a carpenter, earning stabL. income. Her family's average daily income is 150,000VND (about 9.50USD) so it is quite easy for her to repay the loan on an installment basis. Seeing the advantages of borrowing to increase income, she and other villagers have decided to apply for loans so that they can improve their families' economy and skills. Her group also consists of:

Mrs. L. Thi Thuoc (ID Number 03070009), born in 1964, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to purchase a buffalo and invest in breeding ducks.

Mrs. H. Thi Chien (ID Number 03070010), born in 1965, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in her cafe.

Mrs.N. Thi Hoai (ID Number 03070046), born in 1985, would like to borrow 2,756,000VND to open a woodcarving shop.

Mrs. L. Thi Xuyen (ID Number 03070007), born in 1966, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in crafting.

Mrs. H. Thi Thao (ID Number 03070008), born in 1984, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in her souvenir shop.

Mrs. L. Kim Oanh (ID Number 03070011), born in 1959, would like to borrow 3,604,000VND to invest in her butcher shop.

The total amount requested is 1450USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by Pham Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Khiêm, sinh năm 1974(Ms 03070006), mức vay:3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán hàng hoa quả.Vợ chồng chị có hai con nhỏ đang trong độ tuổi đi học.Hàng ngày chị đi chợ bán hoa quả, chồng chị là thợ mộc có thu nhập ổn định. Thu nhập bình quân mỗi ngày của vợ chồng chị khoảng 150.000 vnđ nên rất dễ dàng với những khoản vốn vay trả góp.Thấy được lợi ích của vay vốn phát triển kinh tế, chị và những người trong làng mạnh dạn đăng ký tham gia vay vốn với mục tiêu cải thiện mức sống, kỹ năng sống.Trong nhóm chị còn có:

  • Lê Thị Thước (Ms 03070009), sinh năm 1964, mức vay:3.604.000 vnđ để chăn nuôi vịt và mua một con trâu
  • Hoàng Thị Chiến (Ms 03070010), sinh năm 1965, mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa hàng giải khát.
  • Nguyễn Thị Hoài (Ms 03070046), sinh năm 1985, mức vay: 2.756.000 vnđ để đầu tư mở xưởng gỗ.
  • Lê Thị Xuyến (Ms 03070007), sinh năm 1966, mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư làm đồ thủ công mỹ nghệ.
  • Hoàng Thị Thảo (Ms 03070008), sinh năm 1984, mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư bán đồ lưu niệm.

    • Lê Kim Oanh (Ms 03070011), sinh năm 1959, mức vay: 3.604.000 vnđ để đầu tư bám hàng thịt lợn .

loans.use: Sellign fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Kristina P.

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 32-year-old Kristina  M.. She is married and has three children aged six, nine and 12. In 2001, Kristina established her crops-selling business. Kristina requires a loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy crops in bulk

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. joined TYM in 2005. At first she borrowed VND 3 million to grow shrimp, as she and her husband had been experienced in aquaculture for almost 10 years. This business brings a considerable income for the family. At present, Mrs. L. helps her husband with shrimp growing and weaves mats to generate extra income for her family. Owing to their diligence and effective use of loans, Mrs. L.'s standard of living is improving more and more with an income of VND 80,000/year. For the next loan cycle, she is applying for VND 7 million to buy more breeding shrimp.

loans.use: Buy more breeding shrimps

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 35 años, es soltera  y madre de dos hijas, Yessica de 14 y Yobana de 3.   La venta de fibra de alpaca, es el negocio al que se dedica Olga desde hace ya 10 años atrás para mantener a sus dos hijas, las cuales aun cursan estudios primarios y secundarios.  Vende durante las ferias en los distritos de la ciudad de Juliaca viajando frecuentemente por estas zonas, rindiéndole buenos ingresos económicos.  A Olga le gusta ser independiente, mantenerse y mantener a sus hijas gracias a su trabajo, lo difícil de tener que trabajar es tener que viajar constantemente y no poder estar al lado de sus hijas.   Para Olga es muy importante ver a sus hijas profesionales y con un futuro prometedor.  Con el dinero obtenido, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para en el futuro tener un negocio mucho más grande, y poder brindarles mayores comodidades a sus dos queridas hijas.
texts.en:
Olga is 35 years old. She is single and has two daughters - Yessica who is 14 and Yobana who is three. She has dedicated herself to the sale of alpaca wool for ten years in order to support her two daughters who are in school. She sells during the fairs in the various neighborhoods of the city of Juliaca and travels frequently to these areas. This business provides her with a good income. Olga likes to be independent and to support herself as well as her daughters. The difficult part of her job is having to travel constantly and not be able to be with her daughters. It is very important for Olga to see her daughters become professionals with a promissing future. She will use the money she obtains from this loan to purchase a greater quantity of merchandise so that in the future she can have a much larger business and be able to provide more comforts to her two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the quantity of merchandise (alpaca wool) that she sells.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man K., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Zi Mat, 38, live along national road number six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have five children; two sons and three daughters. Two of their children are silk weavers, their other two children study in the local school, and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Man has been fishing since 1985. He fishes in the Mekong river and sells the fish in the local market. His wife has been weaving silk for two years. It is a skill she learned from her mother. She was hired by villagers to weave silk to get extra income. Man is requesting a loan to repair fishing materials.

loans.use: To repair fishing materials

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Mrs. Oun S. is a farmer who lives in Andoung Samreth village in Takeo Province. She owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces some problems because her field is infertile and she does not have enough money to hire a laborer with two oxen for plowing the field. In order to resolve this, she decided to request for a loan for these.

Mrs. Oun S. is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school. Her husband, Mr. Heng Makara, is a construction worker. Her husband is present on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire a laborer with two oxen for plowing the field.

loans.name: Manzura
