texts.ru: Сатторова Манзура 37лет мать двоих детей,разведённая.Проживает в городе Костакоз, работает санитаркой в поликлинике.Манзура со своим братом занимается купля продажей скота в выходные дни.Её брат помогает ей  как по жизни, так и по бизнесу.Он её посоветовал купить подешевле на рынке несколько баранов.Поэтому Манзура решила взять кредит в Микроинвесте.При мониторинге Манзура была на работе , поэтому её фото сделано в офисе.
texts.en:
Manzura S. is a 37-year-old divorced mother of two children. She lives in the town of Kostakoz, and works as a nursing assistant in a medical clinic. In partnership with her brother, Manzura buys and sells cattle on her days off. Her brother helps her out with both business and personal matters. He advised her to buy several rams at the market while they were cheap, and therefore Manzura has decided to take out a loan with MicroInvest. When we stopped by, Manzura was at work, so her photograph was take in the office.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling of cattle

loans.name: Tila

texts.en:
Muhammad Tila, an educated and married man, has worked in agriculture for more than 10 years. With plenty of land available for cultivation, this hard-working man is requesting a loan to complete his stock, buy more seeds and ready his land for cultivation. Tila is striving for success as a farmer to support his family and help build a better future for his children. He also has a second business, a small café in Jalalabad.

Tila is very happy about this programs of small loans in Jalalabad, Afghanistan. He would like to thank everybody supporting him and hopes to continue his partnership with both Kiva and AFSG in the years to come.

loans.use: Buy seeds and necessary things for his land

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Муаззам удачно закончила очередной займ и хочет ещё получить кредит.С каждым месяцем у неё оборот меняет ассортимент, т.е увеличивается и становится разнообразным.Муаззам женщина которая зря время не теряет, а старается улучшить положение семьи и увеличить свой оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Muazzam successfully repaid her last loan and would like to receive another. Every month her inventory changes with turnover; that is, it expands and diversifies. Muazaam is a woman who does not waste time. Instead she constantly strives to improve her family's position and increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shoes

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio inició el negocio antes de tener su farmacia, ella trabajo en una, vio que era un buen negocio y decidío abrir una.
Comenzó el negocio en Abril de 1999 busco un lugar apropiado con amplio mercado, poca competencia y con recursos propios y de su esposa, juntos emprendieron su proyecto y ahora es una realidad.

La experiencia en farmacia al dar alguna asesoría y los descuentos con sus proveedores le permiten ofrecer a sus clientes algunos productos a precios accesibles además de la buena atención y horario disponible.


El necesita un prestamo por MXN $3,000 que pagara en 8 catorcenas para aumentar sus inventarios, mejorar la atención al cliente, ya que en ocasiones la demanda es mucha y el surtido de medicamentos es poco.
texts.en:
Mauricio started in the business before opening his own pharmacy. He used to work in one, saw that it was a good business, and decided to open his own. He started his business in April 1999. He looked for a good location with ample demand and little competition, and using their own resources, he and his wife embarked on their project, which is now a reality. His prior experience dispensing advice, and discounts from his suppliers allow him to offer his customers products at reasonable prices, as well as good customer service and accessible hours of operation. He needs a loan of MXN $3000, which he will pay off in 8 bi-weekly payments, to increase his inventory and improve his customer service, as sometimes the demand is too high and the supply of medicines is too low.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Maqbool

texts.en: Maqbool baji has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Paksitan for the past 16 years. Her husband is M. P. and he is a painter by profession. He paints doors, windows, and houses. He only goes to work when people call him to paint their houses. He has four years of experience in this profession. Maqbool baji sews clothes. She takes orders from her neighbors. She sews clothes to pay their utility bills. She is applying for a loan to buy paint brushes for her husband’s paint business.

loans.use: To buy paint brushes

loans.name: Olim

texts.ru: Олим – мужчина средних лет (37 лет), женат и отец 3-детей. У Олима есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 30 овец и 10 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Олим каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Олима пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Олим за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Олим очкнь рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Olim is a married middle-age man (37 years old). He is a father of three. Olim owns 30 sheep and 10 goats. His wife is a homemaker. In her free time, she processes wool and knits warm clothes, which she then sells to her neighbots and relatives. Olim would like to get a loan so that he could purchase two bulls. He would like to raise these bulls and resell them at a higher price. Olim is very happy to be able to cooperate with us because credit helps him a lot.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mrs. Run K. is 37 years old and married to Mr. Chlang, 39. They currently make a living fishing in and around the public lake in Kompong Tom Province. The couple are good parents who are very responsible to their three teenage children, including their food, clothing and medical care.

The family now can't catch much fish due to a lack of fishing tools. Therefore, K. would like a loan from Kiva in order to buy a boat to support her fishing business.

loans.use: To buy a boat

loans.name: Sakina Muhammad Bashir Group

texts.en:
Razia baji wants a loan to buy toys for her toy shop. Kosar baji and Ailas baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap businesses. Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread, and cloth) for her decorative embroidery business.

Sakina baji is the group leader of these five ladies. They all are citizens of a city named Kasur, Pakistan. Kasur city is famous for its sweetmeats and for its shrines. Sakina baji has a very good nature and she is a very hardworking lady. She prepares "Paranda" and sells to the shops. Parandas are famous among women who use it to bind their hair tightly. Her husband's name is M. B., who is a carpenter and makes furniture on order. She is applying for a loan to buy wood so that her husband can complete customers' orders. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S. L. currently sells fish that she gets from her husband’s fishing (her husband is a local fisherman). As another source of income, her husband raises a few cows for their offspring to sell. This modest couple now has three children who are of school age. Im S. L. humbly requests a loan to replace an old fishing tool that has broken. 
The two people shown in the picture are Mrs. Im S. L., 38, and her husband, age 41.

loans.use: To replace an old fishing tool that has broken

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia M. is a 62-year-old from Silongon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, married with three children. Due to financial insufficiency she decided to engage in food retailing to have assistance in finances, specifically in their daily basic needs and school allowances. Mrs. M. is now on her 10th loan, requesting PHP 6,000. Her loan is intended for additional capital for food retailing. Her regular customers are their friends, neighbors, and relatives.

Lilia M. dreams of a comfortable living, having enough income to sustain their daily needs and having money for their old age.

loans.use: additional capital for food retailing

loans.name: Tozagul

texts.ru: Калонова Тозагул проживает в районе Турсунзаде. Возраст 48 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Тозагул по специальности 10 лет проработала мед-сестрой. В данный момент она более 6 лет занимается торговлей. Она имеет прилавок, где торгует хот-догом, напитками морожным и т.д. Муж работает на стройке. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Tozagul K. lives in the Tursun-zoda region. She is 48 years old, married and has four children. Tozagul has worked in her profession as a nurse for ten years. At this time she has been in retail for more than six years. She has a vendor stall where she sells hot dogs, soft drinks and ice cream. Her husband works in construction. She is asking for a loan to increase turnaround.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase turnaround

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka runs a business selling tea leaves in the Oile Market of Kisumu. She is part of a network of business ladies who sell similar items there. They are on different sides of the market and have different customers, but provide each other with support since they know the challenges of each other’s business. With her loan, Milka wants to buy a bigger supply of tea leaves.

A few years ago, Milka left her abusive husband and set out on her own. She says that things aren’t easy, but that she has big dreams. She wants to build her own house instead of renting from someone else. She doesn’t have any children of her own, but she looks after the two children of her deceased brother. It is tough for her to feed and clothe the children, but she knows that she is the only one they can count on.

loans.use: More tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn V. is from the village of Biasong. She is 32 years old. Analyn is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Analyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Analyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analyn successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Analyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her fishing business

loans.name: Help Yourself #3 Group

texts.en:
Augustine is a 25-year-old widow with two small children, ages 2 months and 2 years old. She also takes care of an orphan. Augustine’s business is dry meat, which she buys wholesale and sells in a temporary market stall alongside approximately 100 other vendors of various trades. She is successful because her customers like her personality and customer service. Augustine has completed the 11th grade but was forced to drop out before graduation. She lives in remote Kolahu city in rural Lofa County – the breadbasket of Liberia. 

Augustine's dream is to grow her business until she can build a permanent shop. With the profits from her business, Augustine dreams of raising her family well and sending all her children to school, which she was unable to complete.

"Help Yourself #3" is a group of five borrowers, led by Augustine H., living in Kolahu, Lofa County, Liberia.

loans.use: To buy one carton of meat

loans.name: Dudu

texts.en:
Dudu A. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the nearby market and is requesting a loan to purchase shoes to sell. Dudu is 38 years old and is widowed. She has 4 children and her children go to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open another selling point in another area.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Jacob Mukangai

texts.en:
Jacob is 38 years old, married and blessesd with five children. His agricultural business is located at Seregeya market in Eldoret. He was introduced to KADET by a friend.

With the loan Jacob receives from KADET, he intends to buy more sheep.In the future he aspires to excel in his business and be able to educate his children. One day, he hopes to be able to buy a plot of land for his family in order to better meet his family's basic needs.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more animals for his agricultural business

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola is 33 years old and sells sarongs and bottles of wine. She is married with one child. Her husband works in a financial institution.She started this business in 2000 and is happy because her business is expanding. Bukola hopes to receive a loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more sarongs and bottles of wine to sell.She says thanks to all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of sarongs and bottles of wine to sell

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn has been engaged in direct selling for almost nine years now. Her net profit per month is PHP 500-750. She decided to request from KIVA lenders a loan of PHP 7,000.00 for additional capital to improve her business. She plans also to use it for repair and maintenance of their motorcycle.
Her husband is a tricycle driver and operator. Their marriage is blessed with five children. Their eldest is already married; the next is a tricycle driver;  then comes a third year high school student, a preschooler, and a two-year-old girl. She wants to improve and expand her business to earn more income so that she can pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: Additional capital to improve her business

loans.name: Shurenchimeg

texts.en:
Shurenchimeg D. is 37 years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Bayanhongor province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Her two sons are 12 and 18 years old and go to a local secondary school. Shurenchimeg and her family used to be herders but moved to their current town a few years ago after losing much of their livestock in a harsh winter. She now works as a sewer and makes various traditional clothes for locals. She is a talented sewer who learned about making traditional clothes from her mother. She has been making traditional clothes since her family moved in 2006. With the business profits, she has been able to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband and his business. She says that she works hard to set aside some money to purchase a piece of land where she can live with her family in peace because her family currently lives on someone else's land which causes strains.

Shurenchimeg would like a loan to purchase cotton, silk and other necessary materials for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is currently in the business of selling mobile phones and is requesting a loan to stock more phones to sell.  Victoria is 25 years old and is married to an electrical engineer. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up an internet cafe.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more phones to sell

loans.name: Bremilda

texts.es: Bremilda tiene 45 años, vive al lado de su hijo Eurles de 19 años en su casa propia.Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de cerveza en su domicilio, actividad que realiza con entusiasmo  porque la hace sentir muy independiente, también  vende desde su casa adquiriendo esta bebida de una distribuidora para ofrecerla  por cajas a las tiendas de su barrio, y cuando se las piden sus conocidos para toda clase de celebraciones. Siente que esta actividad es muy cansada ya que muchas veces  debe transportar las cajas sola, aunque a  veces  la ayuda su hijo. Se siente muy reconfortada con su  trabajo ya que  le ha dado grandes satisfacciones, gracias a la buena clientela que tiene, y como ella  es una mujer muy activa  siempre esta pensando innovar en los negocios   para poder mejorar en la vida  para beneficio de  su familia.Es su cuarto crédito con  MFP y promete ser puntual como siempre en cada uno de sus pagos.Con el dinero de este préstamo comprará más cajas de cerveza, y así espera obtener buenas ganancias por las celebraciones de fin de año, que están muy cerca.
texts.en:
Bremilda is 45 years old, lives next to her son Eurles who is 19 years old in her own house. For the last three years she has dedicated herself to the sale of beer from her home, which is undertakes with enthusiasm because it allows her to be independent. She also sells crates of these drinks from her home to the stores in her neighborhood, as well as when it is requested for all types of celebrations. This activity is very tiring as it requires a lot of transportation on her part, most of which she does alone, although sometimes her son helps. She is very comforted by her work which brings her much satisfaction, thanks to the good customers she has. As she is a very active woman she is always thinking about how to improve her business in order to improve her life and benefit her family. She is asking for a loan from MFP and promises to be punctual with each of her reimbursements. With the money from this loan she will purchase more crates and beer, and in this way hopes to gain more profits from the end of the year celebrations which are very soon.

Translated from Spanish by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger quantities of merchandise

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Buenaventura pertenece al Banco Comunal “COMUZONE” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 65 años y es casada. 
 
Buenaventura es una madre trabajadora y se dedica alquilar habitaciones D. su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica al servicio D. alquilar habitaciones y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar uso personal desea comprar medicamentos. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Buenaventura belongs to the Comuzone Communal Bank with the Arariwa Association. She is 65 and married. Buenaventura is a hard-working mother. She rents out rooms in her house. She has been renting rooms for several years, and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She needs a loan for personal use; she wants to buy medicine. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medicine for personal use

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon V.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She is 52 years old, widowed and has three adult children. She is from the village of Parug-Parog, Solana, Cagayan. Corazon has been in her business for over 34 years and earns approximately 70,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every four months or during harvest time. In 2008, Corazon joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 37,000 PHP from ASKI. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 45,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Guapa del barrio San Juan de la ciudad de Luque, se formó gracias a la invitación que recibieron del comité Divino Niño Jesús del mismo barrio para la formación de un nuevo grupo. 

Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el tercer ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya y está conformado por 18 integrantes que invierten en distintas actividades.

Cada una de la señoras cuenta con una actividad distinta e independiente pero siempre con el espíritu de unión y apoyo entre las integrantes así se comenta el caso de la  señora Susana P. quien  se dedica a la venta de ropas, esta actividad la realiza de diversas formas ya sea visitando a sus clientes o exponiendo frente a su casa sus productos, a ella le gusta mucho esta actividad ya  mediante la venta de sus productos puede ayudar a su marido con los gasto de la casa, el crédito lo destino para la compra de remeras, busos, pantalón, blusas, short, entre otros.
Se citan las actividades de las demás integrantes: 


1

Venta de ropas
2

texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa committee from Luque’s San Juan neighborhood was organized thanks to an invitation from the Divino Niño Jesús committee of the same neighborhood to form a new group. Currently, the committee is in its third loan cycle with Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya and is composed of 18 members who invest in various commercial activities. Each woman has a different and independent line or work but all share the spirit of unity and mutual help among themselves. We can emphasize Susana P.’s case: she sells clothing in various sales modalities. Sometimes she visits customers in their homes, other times she sets up a sales stand in front of her house. She enjoys her work very much because, through her sales, she is able to help her husband meet household expenses. She will use the funds to buy t-shirts, sweaters, pants, blouses, shorts, etc. The other members are involved in the following activities: 1 Susana P. Clothing sales 2 Romi C. Athletic shoe sales 3 Filomena A. Dairy products sales 4 Julia Y. Costume Jewelry Sales 5 Antonia E. Food Sales 6 Flamilia B. Handicrafts 7 Eulalia Y. Food Sales 8 Aida D. Lingerie Sales 9 María Cristina R. Clothing Sales 10 Digna R. Beverages Sales 11 Luciana A. Charcoal Sales 12 Myrian G. Stationery Store 13 Sonia Y. Clothing Sales 14 Mirtha A. Clothing Sales 15 Lucia R. Beverage and Food Sales 16 Mirta S. Beverage Sales 17 Alicia C. Jewelry Sales 18 Liliana R. Beverage Sales

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Luiza Mirbaeva's Group

texts.en: Luiza is 43 years old and has one daughter, a college student, who will be a financial officer in the future. Luiza has a food outlet but, due to various reasons, she had to stop her business. Now she is asking for the loan to resume it. She will buy mainly food. Luiza loves her daughter and is trying to provide her with the best that is available. Mavludahan, 50, is married with four children: two sons and two daughters. She is a nurse in the village medical centre and her husband works in the educational department. This loan will be used for consumer needs. Shyrmanhan is 47 years old. She is divorced and is raising two children. She is the head of a local veterinary service and also has additional income since she is involved in livestock breeding. She has been in this business for eight years, helped by her son. First she bred sheep but later started breeding cattle. Her loan will be used to buy a milk cow. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To resume operation of her food store

loans.name: Philo

texts.en: Philo is a happy and hardworking woman. She is married to a commercial driver and they have four children who are doing well in business and school. Philo sells locally made soap, called soda, at retail prices to her customers. She also sells peanuts and cellophane bags. She works for long hours to support her husband in meeting the basic needs of the family. She hopes to grow her business and is requesting a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more locally made soap (soda) to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more locally made soap (soda) to sell

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep T., 65, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for fishing and palm products. She is a housewife and her husband is a barber, earning an income of USD 7 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to construct a roof of their house. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to expand her husband’s barber shop. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To build a roof on their house

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi B. lives with her husband and her three children and supports her husband in the general welfare of the family. She has received junior high education.

Esi sells onions at Akotokyire which she has been doing for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more onions to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To buy more onions to sell

loans.name: Bijeshwori

texts.en:
Bijeshwori N. is a resident of Tangal, Lalitpur, and lives with her husband and one son. Tangal is a very busy shopping area of the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. It is especially famous for brass, copper, and bronze pots and utensils in different varieties.

Both Mrs. N. and her husband sell traditional stone statues. They started this work six years ago. They buy ready-made traditional statues and sell them in their shop. For this job, business owners need a lot of capital to invest in their shop.

The demand for these traditional statues is increasing constantly. To meet the demand of the customers, Mrs. N. is requesting a NPR 30000.00 loan to buy traditional stone statues to meet the demand of the customers. Their main targeted customers are foreigners.

loans.use: To buy stone statues

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying fabrics, thread and buttons

loans.name: Aba Adedzewah

texts.en: Aba A. is divorced and has four children. She buys bags of rice and later bags them into smaller quantity for sale by moving from one house to another. She has no educational background. Aba uses her income for the general upkeep of the home.  Aba will use the loan to buy more bags of rice for resale. With the new profits from her extended business, Aba plans to save to buy a shop for her business so she can supply in larger quantities.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice for resale.

loans.name: Mies

texts.en: Mies T., 48, is a rattan cupboard seller  (wife in photo).  He and his wife care for one child.  Two other children are now adults.  Since 2000, Mies and his wife have owned a small rattan cupboard business.  They order rattan items in bulk or braid it themselves and sell door-to-door across the province.  Mies sells his items at a reasonable prices.  In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Mies seeks a loan to stock more rattan to sell.

loans.use: Stock more rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo Aquilino

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 28 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, vive con su esposa sus dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 6 años, posee una tienda de productos de primera necesidad. 
El inicio el negocio hace 15 años, desde muy joven emprendió su venta con pocos productos en la actualidad lo administra  con éxito, es una persona trabajadora, y actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar productos, que le permitan incrementar las ventas, atraer clientes, el quiere invertir en la compra de: Arroz, azúcar, aceite, café, boquitas, bebidas gaseosas. 
Sus aspiraciones son sacar adelante a la familia, apoyas a sus hijos con los estudios, incrementar el negocio para mejor calidad de vida de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 28, lives in the Cinameca municipality in the San Miguel department. He lives with his wife and their two children, ages eight and six. He has a store selling basic needs products. He started his business 15 years ago. When he was very young he undertook his sales with a small amount of products. Now he manages the business successfully. He is a hard-working man. He is currently requesting a loan to buy products, which would allow him to increase his sales and attract customers. He wants to use the loan to buy rice, sugar, oil, coffee, snacks, and soft drinks. His aspirations are to get his family ahead, support his children with their education, and to increase his business in order to improve his loved ones’ quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil, coffee, snacks, and soft drinks

loans.name: Jenny Agustin

texts.es:
Doña Jenny es una mujer trabajadora, de oficio maestra el cual ha sido  su trabajo fijo, también comerciante, de ropa, zapatos, con tres hijos, y su esposo el cual trabaja también como docente.

Juntos han logrado hacer su casa, apoyar a sus hijos, y con los financiamientos que la institución ha dado, ha logrado las mejoras de la casa.
Tiene en proyecto la terminación de un muro solo le falta una parte, el cual el objetivo de este préstamo es para comprar materiales de construcción como: hierro, cemento, piedrin, arena y piedra.
Logrando a si terminar su muro que será de una mejor seguridad.
Contenta por el apoyo que ha recibido para hacer este proyecto ya que es difícil hacer todo al contado por lo caro que esta todo.
texts.en:
Jenny is a hard working woman. She is a teacher by profession and this has been her regular job. She is also a merchant, selling clothes and shoes. She has three children and a husband, who is also a teacher. Together they have been able to build their house and support their children. With the financing the institution has given them, they have been able to make improvements on the home. She has a project finishing a wall and there is only one part left to do. The objective of this loan is to buy construction materials such as: iron, cement, gravel, sand and stone. By finishing the wall, there will be more security. She is happy with the support she has received to do this project since it is difficult to pay for everything upfront because it is all so expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron to finish building a wall, which will provide more security for the family.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta L. is from the village of Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 45 and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Antonieta has a retail store selling vegetables in the local community. Antonieta has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Antonieta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to to purchase additional vegetables to sell and is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Antonieta from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

location.town: Manila Group, Wao, Lanao del Sur

loans.name: C7906 Byukadufatanye Group

texts.en:
Jean is 28 years old and is married with four children.  Jean is the leader of a group called Byukadufatanye.  Jean and his team are well-known in the business of agriculture. They have been in this business for about ten years and the business hours are from 6 a.m. until late in the evening.

Jean and his team need to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With this loan, they will try to expand their business by purchasing a variety of agricultural products as well as items which can play a big role in increasing the crops. If successful, they hope that their profits will increase and these profits will be used for better financial stability in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of agricultural products as well as items to increase the crop

loans.name: Ana Rubidia

texts.es: Ana Rubidia R. D. E. es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora, cuya vivienda y negocio se ubica en el municipio D. Ilopango,  ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador ella tiene en venta gran número D. productos, en su pequeño bazar que lleva por nombre “bazar Josué”, ella vive únicamente  en compañía D. su esposo. Ana  es una mujer decidida y muy preocupada por su hogar y negocio que le ayuda a saldar muchas D. sus necesidades, siendo una gran ayuda en sus ingresos familiares; el préstamo ha sido solicitado para invertir en el bazar y poder hacer compra D. más productos para sus clientes, tales como ropa, zapatos, accesorios para regalo, botones, hilos, agujas y otros más, y D. esta forma hacer crecer el  bazar y tener mayores ingresos que son necesarios para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana Rubidia R. des Estupinina is an entrepreneurial and hard working person. Her business and her home are located in the municipality of Ilopango, in the San Salvador region. She sells a great variety of products from her small bazaar, named Josue's Bazaar. She lives alone with her husband. Ana is a very decided woman and very attentive to her home and business. Through her business she is able to proviD. for many of their necessities, being an important source of income for the family. The loan requested will be invested in her bazaar, in purchasing more products to offer her clients, such as clothing, shoes, gift wrap and bows, buttons, threads, needles, etc. She will be able to expand her store and see better earnings, a necessity for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase general store items.

loans.name: Ashula

texts.en:
Ashula is 47 years old. She is married and has five children between the ages of 9 and 24. All of her children are enrolled in school, although she mentions that paying all of the children’s school fees is a challenge.  

Ashula owns a restaurant where she sells African food. She says that her restaurant is successful because it is clean and she provides good customer care to her clients. 

With the proceeds from this loan, she will buy more types of foods and snacks such as donuts in order to increase her product offering. Any profit that she makes from the business will be used to meet the needs of her children, such as buying food and paying school fees.

loans.use: Food and snacks to sell in her restaurant

loans.name: Teodolinda

texts.es: Teodolinda, de 29 años, es una mujer valiente y luchadora, es madre soltera de 2 hijos, Paola, de 8 y Renzo, de 6 años de edad; ellos viven en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Para poder educar y darle todas las comodidades que se merecen, Teodolinda se dedica a múltiples actividades, una de ellas es la crianza de animales, entre vacas y cerdos, los que cuida y alimenta, ya cuando están gorditos los vende a los comerciantes de una de las zonas aledañas como es el caso de Huasahuasi. La otra actividad que realiza es la agricultura, ahí siembra arveja, papa y maíz, que junto a una amiga, quien dispone de un terreno y Teodolinda los insumos, ya cuando están maduros sus productos, los venden en el mercado central de su ciudad, repartiéndose luego las ganancias. En adelante está planeando comprar mayor cantidad de animales, comprar terrenos de cultivo para poder sembrar por si misma, con las ganancias obtenidas está segura que podrá ahorrar para comprar su propia casa. Es el sexto crédito con MFP y le gusta mucho trabajar con su banco comunal, en el que puede compartir ideas, sabe que unidos podrán salir adelante. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar abono para el cultivo de papa, así mismo desea comprar semillas de arvejas.
texts.en:
Teodolinda, 29, is a brave, hard working woman.  She is a single mother of two children, Paola, 8, and Renzo, 6.  They live in a rented house in Chiras.
In order to provide them with education and the comforts they deserve, Teodolinda is engaged in several activities.  One is raising animals like cows and pigs.  She feeds and cares for them until they are fat and then sells them to merchants in neighboring areas like Huasahuasi.

Another activity is farming.  She grows peas, potatoes and corn alongside a girl friend.  The friend puts in the field and Teodolinda the farming supplies.  When the crops mature they sell them in the city’s central market and they share the profits.

Later on she is planning to buy a larger amount of animals and to buy farmland in order to grow her crops by herself.  She is sure that profits obtained will make it possible for her to buy a house of her own.

This is her 6th loan with MFP.  She likes to work with the communal bank a lot because she can share ideas; she knows that united they can all get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy manure for the potato crops as well as pea seed.

loans.use: To buy manure and pea seed.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya est composé de femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants par femme. Elles habitent le quartier Médine  de la ville de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de mariage. 
Les membres du groupe font l’achat et la vente des crèmes à peau, des habits de la friperie, des pagnes wax, bazins et brodés. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata T. compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 ballons d’habits de la friperie composés de draps et de napperons. Elle se ravitaille en habits au grand marché de Bamako en gros et les revend en détail, au comptant, à crédit, à domicile, au marché Médine de Ségou et en ambulant dans les différents quartiers de la ville à une clientèle constituée généralement de femmes. 
Madame Fatoumata T. compte réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour assurer les petits besoins du foyer et réinvestir dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is composed of married women living mainly in polygamous families, who average 33 years of age and three children. They live in Médine district of the city of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali), and now each other as neighbors and relatives by marriage. The group members retail body cream, used clothing and traditional colorful fabrics of “wax” and “basins” [similar to damask] types as well as embroidered. 

In order to increase their working capital, the group members have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso and are now on the first solidarity loan. Mrs. Fatoumata T. plans to use her loan to purchase two bales of used clothing and linens. She stocks up at the big marked in Bamako, buying wholesale and selling retail, for cash and on credit, out of her home, at the Médine market in Ségou as well as a street vendor in different districts of the city, to a customer base composed mainly of women.

Mrs. Fatoumata T. plans to achieve a monthly benefit of 25,000 West African Francs, which will be used to cover some everyday household needs, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchasing used clothing

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence K. is currently in the business of selling tea and rice in Thura market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and sugar.  Florence is 24 years old and is married to a government staff member. She has one child who does not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: To stock more bags of rice and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of caustic (sodium hydroxide) and palm oil used in the production of soap.

loans.name: Ma Theresa

texts.en:
Nobody wants an unfinished task. Knowing that a winner never quits, Ma Theresa A., moves on from her past with conviction that she will finish whatever she has started, and finish it well. At 46, Theresa is married to Emilio, an employee, and together they raise a child who is now in high school. Theresa did not finish college, but she makes sure that unfinished tasks will never happen again in her life, or the life of her child.

Theresa presently runs a sari-sari (variety) store out of her residence. Being in the business for ten years now, Theresa has been doing well in her business and is earning around 9,000 PHP per month. Bible studies and trainings at CCT* also give her enough encouragement to keep growing and dreaming for greater things in her business and family.

Part of any business is staying profitable, healthy and growing. So to help her grow her business, Theresa has requested a loan for 20,000 PHP. She will use this money to add more items to her store and attract more customers. She also wants to renovate her store and plans to use part of the loan money to start the renovation. She believes that more products on her shelves and a better-looking store would help increase her monthly income.

At present, Theresa admits finding it hard to be in competition with many other sari-sari stores in her area. Also, there are customers who are hard to follow up with in terms of their debts. Theresa also thinks of her child’s high school expenses. However, despite these financial problems, Theresa is certain that she will end up finishing the race of life and emerging the winner. She dreams of seeing her business expand and eventually have branches in many locations. She also desires to help her mother out and of course, to see her child finish college with flying colors.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: Store renovation

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria V. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 54 years old. Eleuteria is widowed and has 7 adult children. To make a living, Eleuteria owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, instant noodles & junk foods in the local community. Eleuteria has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eleuteria joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Eleuteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Eleuteria is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Eleuteria from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell like canned goods & beverages.

loans.name: Sakhavat

texts.ru:
Sakhavat A. 28 let. On ne jenat. Sakhavat yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. 

Sakhavat uje 5 let kak rabotayet masterom domov , etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy toje bil masterom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit instrumenti dlya svoyey raboti.
texts.en:
Sakhat A. is 28 years old. He is single. Sakhava is an Internally Displaced Person. He moved from the town of Fuzuli and currently lives in Baku together with his parents. 

For the five last years, Sakhavat has been working as a construction foreman. He learned this trade from his father, who also used to be a foreman. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy necessary tools  for his work.

loans.use: Purchasing necessary tools

loans.name: Narcisa Natividad

texts.es:
Narcisa de 49 años, comenzó con un negocio de teléfonos monederos poco a poco con el dinero que le ingresaba ella comenzó ahorra hasta que pudo tener sus propias centrales de teléfono en un local para alquilar las llamadas. 

En la actualidad tiene su negocio de servicio telefónico que lo realiza sola desde las 08h00am hasta que termina su jornada de trabajo a las 22h00pm. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el comprando con el préstamo cemento, bloques y arena para darle una mejor adecuación al local y asi sus clientes se sientan muy contentos de ir a llamar. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un cyber.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 49 years old. She started her coin phone business slowly with the money she made. She started saving until she was able to have her own telephones to charge for calls. 

Currently she has a telephone service business where she works from 8:00 am until she finishes her workday at 10:00 pm. She has many aspirations for her business which is why she wants to use the loan to keep buying cement, blocks and sand to better adapt the store front so that her customers will be excited about making calls there. In the future she wants to finish building her house and provide internet service.

loans.use: Purchase cement and blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes and more crates of drinks

loans.name: Bayarjavkhlan

texts.en:
Bayarjavkhlan is 31 years old and lives with her father and husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives in a small house, in the outer ger districts of the city. But she and her husband only live at this home in winter because they plant trees on their land in Selenge province during other seasons. 

Bayarjavkhlan and her husband support their family by planting, growing, and selling trees. Every year, they plant from 800,000 to 1,200,000 pines, firs, maples, seabuckthorns, currants and cedars in association with cooperatives on their land. In addition, they replant 20 to 35 hectares of trees in forests per year. They also rehabilitate 20 to 30 hectares of land every year. She is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase a new type of tree seeds.

Bayarjavkhlan said “I like my job and I think planting trees is a good deed. So in the future, I‘ll plant a lot of trees on the land.” She wants to improve her business with this loan and then she wants to be able to build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase a new type of tree seeds

loans.name: Jessica Len Javier's Group

texts.en:
Jessica Len J. is from the village of San Pablo, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is the leader of an eight-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
 Jessica Len is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Jessica Len has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised pigs.
In 2010, Jessica Len joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Jessica Len is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her third from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.en:
Vladimir is married with two daughters. He is a farmer from Kamenka. Vladimir grows early spring vegetables in his greenhouses. Vladimir owns three spacious greenhouses and another one for seedlings. Vladimir has been growing vegetables in these greenhouses for 8 years. He has already invested about 100,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise. 

Vladimir is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase plastic film, seeds and fertilizers for his greenhouses. He is planning to invest 5,000 Grivnyas in fertilizers, 4,600 in polyethylene film, 1,600 Grivnyas in installation of a heating unit, 1,700 Grivnyas in installation of a drip irrigation unit, and 2,000 Grivnyas in sand and organic matter. Some of Vladimir’s plans are to re-construct one of his greenhouses that needs to be improved and expanded and to install heating units in all three greenhouses (so far he has one boiler for all of his greenhouses).

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita F. is from the village of Sinamar. She is 52 years old. Teresita is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Teresita raises crops, primarily corn, for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 60,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Teresita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Teresita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza L. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old. Analiza is married and has three school-aged children. Analiza sells ready-to-wear clothing, sandals, sleepers, & shoe products in her community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2011, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional t-shirts & blouses. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Analiza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional t-shirts & blouses

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
Paula es una madre de familia  de 46 años de edad vive con su hijo en su casa ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Pimentel.  Se cacteriza por ser un balneario muy concurrido por los pobladores del distrito de Chiclayo,por encontrarse a 15 minutos de distancia especialmente en la época de verano para disfrutar de su playa y ricos potajes (comidas).

Paula se dedica hace más de 10 años a la compra, crianza y venta de aves de corral como gallinas,pavos,patos y gallos al por menor.   Los cría en su corral que se encuentra en la parte posterior de su casa para mayor seguridad de sus animales, los alimenta con comidad balanceada  y lo mas natural posible.  Una vez que han completado su desarrollo los vende a los distintos restaurantes del distrito de Pimentel como el mercado de sitio.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas Paula necesita un préstamo de 2200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para seguir comprando aves de corral y seguir incrmentando sus ventas e ingresos para su casa, cubriendo sus necesidades diarias.

Paula es una mujer responsble, trabajadora y empeñosa conocida por los pobladores del distrito de Pimentel, por querer mejorar  económicamente y cumplir el sueño que se ha trazado, el poderle dar una profesión a su hijo en un futuro cercano.
texts.en:
Paula, age 46, lives with her son.  Her house is in the rural zone of the Pimentel district.  The area is characterized as being a very popular resort with the residents of the Chiclayo district, which is 15 minutes away.  It is especially crowded during the summer when people enjoy its beach and delicious food.

For over ten years Paula has devoted herself to buying, raising, and selling wholesale poultry like chickens, turkeys, and ducks at retail prices.  For greater security, she raises them in the yard behind her house.  She feeds them balanced feed and the most natural feed as possible.  Once they have grown, she sells them to different restaurants such as the market in the Pimentel district. 

In order to be able to increase her sales, Paula needs a loan for 2,200 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She needs to continue buying poultry, to continue increasing her sales and income for her house, and to continue covering the daily necessities.

Paula is a very responsible, hard-working, and tenacious woman.  She is well-known by the residents of the Pimentel district.   She wants to improve financially and to fulfill the dream she has planned.  Her dream is to give her son a profession in the near future.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Mrs. Sun is 58 years old and married. She and her husband offer ferryboat delivery service. They have four children. One of their children is married and the others attend school. This family currently generates an income of approximately $9 per day by providing boat service to domestic people and tourists. They have never wasted their time. They make money to support their kids. Recently, they are facing a problem. Their boat is too old and not attractive to the customers. To solve this obstacle, Mrs. Sun would like to request a loan to buy a new boat that will allow her to add new customers to her clientele.

loans.use: to buy a new boat.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun is a 28-year-old married woman and is blessed with four children. She is a rice farmer who lives in the province of Kompong Cham. Growing crops is an annual action with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Her husband is a domestic construction foreman, who has employees to provide his service. 

Recently, Mrs. Soeun's husband wants to buy a used motorcycle  to ride to work as his existing motorcycle is broken and often needs repair. That is why Mrs. Soeun requested a loan to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband. Mrs. Soeun and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband, as his old one is broken.

loans.name: Sucheat

texts.en:
Sucheat, 32 years old, has been a hair cutter since 1993, and he always gets admiration from his customers about his work. His wife stays home to take care of their child, so every expense in the family is dependent on his career. He can make $6 per day for his income. He has one child, and he is 2 years old. 

Every month, he has to spend $60 on food, and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a motorbike for traveling to work. He plans to repair his hair cut shop by decorating it to be more attractive and he will keep part of the profit from his career so that his child can get a good education in the future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for traveling to work.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “IMASUMAC II”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Huanchac en la Provincia D. Cusco y Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad, la socia es casada, La socia tiene 7 hijos los cuales ya son todos ellos independientes; La socia se dedica a la venta D. joyas D. fantasía fina, la socia trabaja junto a su conyugue y ambos elaboran las diferentes piezas D. aretes, prendedores, anillos, brazaletes, collares, la socia nos comenta que su esposo trabaja en una institución en la cual ella tiene a la mayoría D. sus clientas, la socia realiza bellos y finos acabados los cuales son requeridos por las colegas D. su conyugue y el les hace la propaganda, La socia desea invertir en la compra D. materiales para la realización D. mayor numero D. bisutería, la socia comprara mercadería como mostacillas D. colores, cuarzos, piedrillas, alambres D. diferentes materiales, ganchitos y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. materiales.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the "Imasumac II" community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.

Maria is 58 years old, married, and has seven children who all live independently.  Her business is selling costume jewelry.  She works together with her husband making different pieces of jewelry: earrings, brooches, rings, bracelets and necklaces.  Maria tells us that her husband works in an institution where she has most of her customers.  She makes beautiful and high-quality finishing touches to her jewelry which her husband's work colleagues require.  He markets the products to them.  Maria would like to invest in buying materials to make more jewelry.  She will buy merchandise such as colored beads, quartz, stones, wires maD. from different materials, little hooks, etc.  She is requesting this loan to buy materials.

Maria is grateful for the support that she is being given and she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy materials for making costume jewelry

loans.name: San Marcos Group

texts.en: Dunia, Jose, and Alva, all of whom reside in Danli, Honduras, formed the San Marcos solidarity group in June, 2011. Dunia, the group leader, has made a living for the past year and a half by running a small convenience shop. Her shop is located near a busy street in her village, thus helping her sales. Dunia is requesting a loan of Lps. 8,000 with which to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: to purchase beans, rice, cornmeal, cooking oil, butter, fruits, vegetables, snacks, candy, soft drinks, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning supplies for her store.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Nestor. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Marie prépare de la nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagné de sauce, bouillie d'amidon de maïs, etc.) qu’elle vend dans une ville du Bénin. Marie s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Marie sollicite auprès de ALIDé un troisième prêt. Les deux premiers crédits ont été tous bien remboursés.
texts.en: Marie is 31 years old and married to a driver named Nestor. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Marie lives together with her husband and children. The various household expenses are taken care of by the couple together. Marie did not attend school. To provide for herself and her children, she prepares meals (maize paste with sauce, cornstarch-based 'bouillie', etc.) that she sells in a city in Benin. Marie gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin. With the goal of expanding her business and better responding to the demands of her clientele, Marie is seeking her third loan through ALIDÉ. The two previous loans were both repaid properly.

loans.use: To buy maize, condiments, sugar, and milk.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy, age 27, runs a food shop where she prepares and sells a variety of meat dishes, such as afritada and bulalo. She has had this business for four years. She and her husband have three children.
 
Nancy has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 in order to buy the raw ingredients needed for the meat dishes she prepares and sells.
 
Nancy has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients needed for the meat dishes she prepares and sells

loans.name: Gaby

texts.en: Gaby is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with one parent and two siblings. This young man decided in 2008 to start his own business working as a home electrician. He works at the client’s requests. He has obtained his first Kiva loan and has been a reliable client with punctual payments. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew his business tools to be able to acquire more projects. In the future, he is planning to open his own electric shop.

loans.use: to renew his business tools

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is 43 years old and is a married man with four children. The oldest child is 25 years old.

Ricardo is a farmer working in Sta. Josefa, Agusan Del Sur. He primarily grows rice crops to sell. Ricardo also raises pigs to sell. He also put up a sari-sari store business to help with their daily needs. Ricardo's wife manages the store.

Ricardo has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, pig feed and more items to sell at his store. He hopes for his ventures to prosper in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pig feed and items to sell at his store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking business woman. She 34 years old, married and has two children who are still in school.

For the last seven years, she has been running a wholesale shop to bring up her family. She has worked hard to grow her business. Her desire is to open a supermarket within five years. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy soda and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy soda and maize flour

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Don Jose, de 42 años de edad, es originario de la ciudad de León , esta casado ,padre de dos hijos, el es técnico automotriz, el es dueño de un pequeño taller de soldadura en general. Desde los 15 años de edad, se dedico a la pintura de carro actividad que aprendió en un taller después  aprendió a soldar y fue ahí que decidió tener propio taller de soldadura hoy en día tiene mas de 20 años  de tener su taller .
El realizo este préstamo para compra de materiales para soldadura tales como hierro, platina, angulares, discos, electrodos. Esta inversión le permitirá trabajar con más material, disponer de el de manera inmediata y poder cumplir con su trabajo más eficientemente. Dentro de sus planes futuros quiere comprar una maquina soldador de metaso, remodelar su taller compra mas herramientas modernas para trabajar, buscando el bienestar de su familia que es su objetivo principal.
texts.en:
José, 42, is originally from the city of León.  He’s married and the father of two children.  He’s an auto mechanic and owns a small general welding shop.  Since the age of 15 he’s been painting cars, a skill he learned working in a shop.  Later on he learned how to weld and that’s when he decided to have a welding shop of his own.  To date, he’s had his own shop for more than 20 years.

He took out this loan to buy welding supplies like iron, chrome, metal angles, discs, electrodes.  This investment will make it possible to work with more material and to have it on hand to respond to work orders efficiently.  Part of his future plans is to buy a welding machine, to remodel his shop and to buy more modern work tools seeking to attain his family’s wellbeing which is his main objective.

loans.use: to buy welding supplies.

loans.name: Sohoueto De Womey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SOHOUETO DE WOMEY est composé de vingt trois personnes qui sont toutes membre d'un ancien groupement et habitent dans le même quartier au Bénin. C'est la première fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Thomasia est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo.Thomasia est âgée de 53 ans et vit au Bénin.Thomasia est marié à un agent de police du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés dont deux restent encore à leur charge.  Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par Thomasia et son mari.Thomasia a fréquenté l'école jusqu'à l'université. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants,Thomasia vend des boissons non alcoolisées. A côté de cette activité,Thomasia est la gérante d'une buvette. Thomasia s’approvisionne en boissons au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Thomasia sollicite  ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SOHOUETO DE WOMEY,un premier crédit.
texts.en:
The Sohoueto de Womey group is composed of 23 persons who are all members of a previous group and live in the same area of Benin.
This is the first time this group is requesting financial help from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity.

The leader of the group named Thomasia has her hand raised on the photo. She is 53 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to policeman named Antoine. The couple has three children; all attended school and two of them are still under their care. Thomasia and her husband  cover the various household expenses. Thomasia attended school up to University. To provide for her needs and those of her children she sells non-alcoholic beverages. In parallel to this activity she also manages a refreshment stand. She gets her supplies in Benin.

With her goal of meeting her customers’ demand and to increase her sales and income, Thomasia, along with the other members of the Sohoueto de Womey group, is requesting a first loan.

loans.use: to purchase non-alcoholic beverages.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MANOS JUNTAS DE RUMICHACA ALTA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Emiliana; ella tiene 47 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara estofado de pollo, pollo al horno y sopas, la socia vende en el mercado de Urubamba y también tiene una tierra de cultivo donde siembra arvejas, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de comida y mejorar el negocio de tierra de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras y también para comprar semillas para la tierra de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank “Manos Juntas de Rumichaca Alta.” The bank is located in the Urubamba district, which is in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cuzco.

Emiliana is 47 years old and has four children with her partner. She alternates her daily activities with her food-selling business. She prepares chicken stew, baked chicken, and soups. She sells her food in the Urubamba market, and also has a plot of land where she cultivates peas. Emiliana provides for her children through these businesses. She would like to increase her food-selling business and improve her cultivation business. She is requesting the loan to purchase ingredients like chicken, beef, and vegetables, and also to purchase seeds to plant.

Emiliana is happy to receive the loan and is committed to completing her payments.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients like chicken, beef, and vegetables, and also to purchase seeds to plant.

loans.name: Pascalia

texts.en:
Pascalia lives in the Coastal town of Malindi, Kenya. She is married and has one child in primary school. She has been operating a retail shop for four years. 

Pascalia joined Milango in May and is applying for her second loan of KSH 80,000 from Milango. She intends to use the loan to add to her retail stock of milk, sugar, flour, fat etc. She has set her eyes on growing the business and opening a wholesale one in the future. She also operates a garage with her husband and believes this loan will increase their family income and enable them to educate their child and open other feasible business opportunities. She is glad that Milango has continued to provide credit to entrepreneurs like her.

loans.use: To buy sugar, bread, flour, fat etc

loans.name: Erenita

texts.en:
Erenita is 60 years old and a widow with three children. Erenita works very hard to provide for them.

Erenita runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 Philippines pesos loan through NWTF to buy stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erenita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned good and other groceries. 

Erenita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is married and has one son who is currently 2 and a half years old. Her husband has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

He has more than five years of experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in his area.

To help expand his business, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan will be used to buy more household supplies for the business and will help her husband to generate greater profits and improve the family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy household supplies for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Solanda Maricela

texts.es:
Solanda Maricela tiene 32 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 2 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 15 y 11 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Solanda se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 5 años. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y comprar abonos agrícolas. Con la ayuda del crédito se le hará más fácil al adquirir los insumos.

El sueño es poder tener casa propia. No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta visitar a la mamá.
texts.en:
Solanda Maricela, 32, lives in a common law relationship and has two children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 15 and 11 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.

Solanda has been growing corn and rice for five years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  

She is asking for the loan to plant corn and to buy manure.  With help from the loan it will be easier to acquire the supplies.  Her dream is to own a house.  She’s had no type of problem and in her free time she likes to visit her mother.

loans.use: to plant corn and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Herminigilda

texts.en:
Herminigilda is a married woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has three children, age 17, 10 and 5. Herminigilda’s husband works as a driver.

Herminigilda makes candles to earn a living. She has been in this kind of business for a year. She earns 3,000 PHP per month with this business.

Herminigilda has requested a loan to buy wax, wicks, cans and other materials for making candles. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks, cans and other materials for making candles.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 42 years old and lives in Calunasan, Maria, Siquijor.  She is married with four school-age children.
