Valentina sells fresh fish from her husband's catches to earn a living.  She has been doing this for one year. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase a new set of fishing nets. Fishing is the main source of income for her family.

Valentina has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for one month.  In the future, Valentina hopes to repair their house using the additional income from her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new set of fishing nets

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie works hard to support her family. Elvie is married and sells ready-to-wear clothes in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 2 years.

Elvie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like t-shirts, blouses, pants etc. to sell. 

In the future, Elvie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like t-shirts, blouses and pants to sell.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea engages in cooking and selling street food and different kinds of vegetables, to earn additional income. She has been in this business for almost seven years earning a net profit of only P500 a day.

She aims to improve her business to increase her income to cover all their household expenditures and support her children's needs. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of P15,000 to buy different kinds of vegetables and ingredients (egg, hot-dog, pork and "adiddas") to be cooked and sell in the village. 

She needs to work hard and strive harder to achieve her goals. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. She believes that nothing is impossible to a person who has strong faith and determination.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of vegetables and ingredients (egg, hot-dog, pork and "adiddas") to be cooked and sell in the village

loans.name: George Maurice

texts.en:
George was born in Moch Village in Rarienda District, he is married with children. George has been involved in Motorcycle Taxi Business for two years using a rented motorcycle. He wants to own a motorcycle to support the community health work in his community, George is to be linked with CHW working in East Uyoma and will  support the community health worker by providing transport on set days, this will give the needed capacity to the CHW to be able to reach many more families during  counseling appointments and health visitation. George  hopes to recruit other members of his youth organization to join in supporting community health outreach programme in his community.

George's ambition is to become the customer who has made more hours in CHEs work programme. George  will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his family. He hopes to become a CHW volunteer in his community once he has finished paying for his motorcycle

loans.use: To buy Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 38-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been sewing dolls for the past 6 years to support her family. She beautifully sews dolls at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also works in a factory but earns an insufficient income to support his family alone.

She is a mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase stocks of threads, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behaviour. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children. 

She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy wool, threads, pearls, sequins and cloths for sewing doll to sell.

loans.name: Nonvignon 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON 2 est composé de six personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, nommée Olive Colette (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 42 ans a mis fin a ses études au cours secondaire. Olive Colette est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Ange. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Olive Colette vend des tissus par la méthode de distribution depuis quinze ans environ. De façon secondaire, Olive Colette vend des articles de mercerie ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de sa famille. Olive Colette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Olive Colette ensemble avec les membres du groupement NONVIGNON 2, sollicite pour la cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.

loans.name: Valérie Emma

texts.fr: Valérie Emma âgée de 33 ans, est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Alphonse Nounagnon. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et a leur charge. Valérie Emma vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. les diverses charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Valérie Emma vend divers produits(du lait, des bougies et des bonbons) dans sa région. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Valérie Emma achète ses produits dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Valérie Emma sollicite pour une troisième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: Sonia Dolores

texts.es:
Sonia, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja de albañil y junto a él tienen tres hijos, una estudia y los otros dos trabajan. 

Sonia, vende pupusas, su madre le enseño como hacerlas y ella decidió iniciar con la venta de este productos típico de nuestro país, ella tiene muchos años de vender pupusas y por esa razón ya es muy conocida en la zona. 

Sonia, necesita el préstamo para comprar una plancha nueva para elaborar pupusas, porque la que tenia se la dono a su madre, quien también se dedica al mismo negocio.

Sonia, sueña con seguir trabajando en su negocio.

loans.use: para comprar una plancha nueva para elaborar pupusas.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Mrs. I. is a married woman with three children, living in an urban area in Edo Sate, Nigeria. She cherishes her business so much that she learnt it for a year and later opened hers in 2002. She says if she is loaned the money, it will enable her expand her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Mekke

texts.en: Mekke N. (employee pictured) owns a small clothing stand at the local bazaar in the small town of Khachmaz located on the Northeastern coast of Azerbaijan. Mekke is looking for funding so that she can increase the quantity and variety of her inventory so that she can attract more customers to her stand.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of her inventory.

loans.name: Suy

texts.en:
Mr. Suy S. is 46 years old, married, and a father of 7 children. He lives in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where he works as both a motor-taxi driver and a construction foreman. For his business activity, he typically makes about $4/day, while his wife works at the local garment factory and contributes a meager sum to the household. Meanwhile, 3 of his children are garment workers and the rest are students.

Suy S. is requesting a loan amount of $700 to purchase a motorcycle for his business. He hopes he can save enough money to increase his collection of construction tools to make additional income from his profession for years to come.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to operate a business.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es:
Description of Business

Griselda sells a brand of perfumes well recognized in her country. She also sells clothes to her neighbors who live nearby. She started her business with the support of her husband, her loaned her money to invest.

Use of Loan

Griselda will use the loan to buy merchandise, as well as an aluminum and glass display table. She also has in mind to invest in small household appliances which her customers have asked for.

Personal Information

Griselda is 39 years old, married, and has 6 children who go to school. Their house is made of cane, and her main objective is to improve the quality of their lives and construct a house made of cement.

Descripción del Negocio

La Sra. Griselda se dedica a la venta de perfumes de una merca reconocida en el pais y ademas vende tambien ropa a los vecinos de su sector. Ella empezo su negocio con apoyo de su esposo quien le presto capital para que invierta

Uso del Préstamo

Ella usara el credito para comprar la mercaderia y ademas un mostrador de alumnio y vidrio. Tambien tiene pensado invertir en pequeños electrodomesticos que tambien le han solicitado sus clientes.

Información Personal

Griselda tiene 39 años de edad y esta casada tiene 6 hijos que estudian su casa es de caña y su principal objetivo es de mejorar su calidad de vida y construir su vivienda de cemento

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: Buy merchandise and a display table

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is an artisan like many of the women of her community. She embroiders tablecloths, napkins, shawls, cushions, blouses, and she sells with the wholesalers in a nearby village. She is 35 years old, has six children, and is part of the group Lilz 3 together with Maria Sanchez Vazquez (another artisan). The loan will enable the wholesale purchase of thread.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA es artesana como muchas mujeres de su comunidad, borda manteles, servilletas, chales, cojines, blusas y lo vende con los mayoristas del pueblo más cercano. Ella tiene 35 años, seis hijos y forma parte del grupo llamado Liliz 3 junto con doña Maria Sánchez Vázquez (artesana). Con sus prestamos invertirán en la compra de hilo al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase thread for embroidery work

loans.name: Sokphoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. D. Sokphoeun and her husband Mr. Pun Sothea married in 1997 and have four daughters. She learned to weave silk from a relative in 1998 and started her silk production business in the same year. Her husband has been teaching in the local junior high school since 1992. Two of Sokphoeun’s daughters are studying in primary school and other two as yet too young to attend school.

Sokphoeun has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times alreaD.. She is now requesting a $400 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.use:
Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, fees for 
selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Mazama

texts.fr:
Mr. Mazama T. is 35 and a married father of four children. For over seven years, Mr. T. has earned his living by purchasing ripe palm trees, cutting them down, extracting the juice and turning it into alcohol. He has built an alcohol production factory, where he works. He sells the liquor in neighboring towns and villages. With the income he earns from this business, he pays his family’s expenses. He has recently found a palm tree field with 200 palm trees that he would like to purchase with this loan.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Mazama T. est agé de 35 ans marié et père de 4 enfants. Depuis plus de 7 ans l'activité génératrice de revenu de Mr Mazama T. est d'acheter les palmiers murs, les abattre , extraire le jus et le transformer en alcool Il a crée une usine de production de l'alcool dans laquelle il travail. Il revend la liqueur dans les villages et villes environnant. Avec le revenu de cette activité il finance les charges de famille. Actuellement il a trouvé un champ de palmerai de 200 palimier qu'il voudrait acheter avec le présent emprunt

loans.use: Purchase of 200 palm trees to extract alcohol

loans.name: Teresa Graciela

texts.es:
Teresa Graciela is 52 years old and she studied until second graD. of Primary school. She has 4 kids who don't live with her anymore, and she lives in the district of Mache, in the province of Otuzco, in the state of La Libertad.

She sells cereals such as wheat, peas and barley, which she gets during the harvest and also buys in large quantities in different ranches. She also has some machines to grind cereals to make barley flour, wheat flour and maizemeal among others. She mainly takes these products to Trujillo to sell. When she has some left over she takes advantage of this by adding some milk and making curds, and in this way she has another income.

She is a member of the group 'Women of Mache', a place where she got her first loan of $300, and with this money she bought sacks of cereal. With the loan of $2500, which she will pay back in 4 months, she will buy 10 sacks of wheat, 15 of barley and peas.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Teresa Graciela tiene 52 años D. edad, estudió hasta el segundo grado D. primaria, tiene cuatro hijos que ya no dependen D. ella y vive en el distrito D. Mache, provincia D. Otuzco, departamento D. La Libertad. Se dedica a la venta D. cereales tales como trigo, alverja, cebada, y chochos, los cuales adquiere D. su cosecha y también compra al por mayor en los diferentes caseríos. También posee maquinarias para moler estos cereales y elaborar harina D. alverja, morón, D. cebada, maicena, entre otras. Estos productos los lleva a vender al por mayor en la ciudad D. Trujillo. Cuando le sobra un poco D. tiempo lo aprovecha para sacar leche D. sus reses y hacer cuajada, D. esta manera tiene otro ingreso. Es socia del banco comunal “Mujeres D. Mache”, lugar donD. obtuvo un primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 y con este dinero compró sacos D. cereales. Con el préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 10 sacos. D. trigo, 15 sacos D. cebada, alverja y chochos.

loans.use: To buy products (wheat, barley, peas) / Compra de productos (trigo, cebada, alverja)

loans.name: Kani East A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Saida N.. She is currently in the business of running a grocery store and is requesting a loan to purchase more groceries to sell. Saida is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 16 and her children go to school. Each week, Saida makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and invest more in her business. Saida has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Saida is joined in her small group by Zaituni N. and Esther M.. Zaituni N. has a business selling charcoal and wants to purchase more bags of charcoal to increase stock. Esther M. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to add more working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Oleg

texts.en:
Oleg has a little business selling a variety of tools and accessories in the auto parts section of the busy Central Market in Melitopol, Ukraine. He has a nice location at the market that is convenient and offers good visibility to passing customers. Oleg has been in business for about eight years. He has established good relations with his co-workers in the market and has a loyal client base. Not married at the moment, he is making preparations to have a family in the future.

Oleg has requested a loan of $800 to purchase new inventory. The ability to buy more inventory at low prices will give Oleg the opportunity to increase his profits and continue developing a successful enterprise while improving his standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory for his business

loans.name: Julieth's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Julieth is 39 years old and is married with 4 children, aged 21, 18, 14 and 11. Julieth owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2006. She works every day from 8 am to 7 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $60 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Agnes, who has a business dealing in used clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
Maria is married with 4 children, 23, 24, 30 and 32. She started her business because she only had an elementary-school education and it was the work that provided her with an income to live. She started 8 years ago with a small amount of jewelry bought with a loan. Later she paid cash and, little by little, the business grew until she had her own shop, well established, where she also resells shoes and "blancos" bought from catalogs.

Maria now needs a US$875 loan, to be repaid in 6 months, to remodel her shop because she doesn't currently have enough money to cover the expense. With your help, Maria can continue her progress.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

María es casada y madre de 4 hijos de 23, 24, 30 y 32 años. Inició su negocio ya que solo cuenta con estudios de primaria y fue el oficio que le dejo ganancias para subsistir. Comenzó hace 8 años inicio con un pequeño lote de joyería que saco a crédito, después compro de contado y así poco a poco fue creciendo, hasta tener su local bien establecido donde además vende zapatos y blancos por catalogo.

Ahora ella necesita un crédito por US $875 que pagara en 6 meses, para remodelar su local, ya que actualmente no cuenta con liquidez para solventar ese gasto. Con tu apoyo María seguirá progresando.

loans.use: Remodel store.

loans.name: Serwaa

texts.en: Serwaa A. is thirty five years old. She is married with three children. Currently, one of them has completed junior high school and is ready to enter senior high school, but the rest are in primary school. She is a retailer of charcoal and frozen fish in her local community. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all the traditional Ghanaian homes. Serwaa obtains her supply of charcoal from the villages and retails it to her customers. She also supplies her customers with fresh fish for their meals. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of charcoal and fire wood to increase her stock. She belongs to the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay the loan. Serwaa was photographed during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of charcoal and fire wood.

loans.name: Zunny

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 44 year-old Zunny M..  She is married, and has three children aged 14,17 and 24. She has two dependents who live with her because they are orphans.  In 2004, Zunny established her Mama Lishe/café business. Working seven days a week, and thirteen to sixteen hours a day, she earns about US $90 every month from this business. Zunny requires a loan in order to buy more kitchen utensils. In the future, Zunny plans to investing in other businesses. She thanks you for your support.  

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal, and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot sticky dough, made from maize flour), plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Azizan's Group

texts.en:
Azizan baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 30 years. Azizan baji is the mother of seven children: four sons and three daughters. Her husband makes cloth from his power loom machines and sells them in the market and earns a good profit. Azizan baji is a housewife and also sells thread to different areas. She owes a two-room brick house. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy oil to save their power looms machine from rust.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Tasleem baji, Bushra baji, and Hajira baji each want a loan to buy thread to resell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy oil for a machine

loans.name: Hadjah Namuwawu's Group

texts.en:
Hadjah is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 55 years old and divorced with 6 children aged between 30 and 18 years. Two of her children go to school, and the rest are working. She stays with her brother who owns the home where she is staying with her school-going children. There are four people at home.

The family gets two meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. Hadjah works in Kibuye market in one of the city suburbs and deals in bananas. Hadjah doesn't incur any extra transport costs because she gets them from her place of work. She works seven days a week.

Hadjah sells to an average of 20 customers a day and sells both small and large quantities depending on the customers' wishes. Her main expenses include school fees and medication plus daily market dues.

She has been with MCDT for four years and is servicing her twelfth loan with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to increase the stock of her business. She aspires to educate her children up to university. .

loans.use: To incease stock in her business

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es: Doña Maria comenzó el destace de cerdo y lo hacia una vez a la semana, actualmente destaza dos cerdos a la semana y los fines de semana vende nacatamales, ella comercializa en su casa de habitación, su esposo la ayuda para sacar adelante el negocio  en el futuro piensa poner una crianza de cerdos, y para esto cuenta con la ayuda de los créditos de Adim. Tiene 3 hijos, los que asisten a clases y su esposo también trabaja en labores de agricultura, esta familia tiene su propia casa, están ahorrando para comprarse un TV y regalárselos en navidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria began butchering pigs once a week. At present, she butchers two pigs a week, and on the weekends, she sells nacatamales. She markets her products in her home. Her husband helps her to go forward in her business. In the future, she thinks about breeding pigs, and for this, she is counting on loans from Adim. She has 3 children, who are studying, and her husband also works in farm labor. This family has their own house. They are saving to buy a TV and give it to their children for Christmas.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells underwear and sarongs. Maria travels to Togo to purchase underwear and sarongs to sell in Lagos State. Maria is 46 years old and married with 6 children. She is a LAPO client.

Maria needs the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more underwear and sarongs to sell. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers during and after the festive season. She says thank you to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more underwear and sarongs to sell

loans.name: South

texts.en: Mrs. South D. was born in 1957 and she now lives in Phlov Veay village, in Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a small store where she sells rice and grocery products. Since this business is going well, she would like to expand it. She has decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice to re-sell. South is a widow with three children, two of whom are working in a garment factory while the youngest one is attending the local school.

loans.use: Purchase more rice to re-sell.

loans.name: Lukia Nassuna ‘S Group

texts.en:
Lukia is the leader of a four member group. She is 57 years old and the mother of five children between the ages of 19 and 37. Two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She resides in a four roomed house that she owns in which four people stay. They have electricity and piped water at home and the family gets three meals a day. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala.

Lukia deals in ladies shoes on William street in Kampala city and works seven days a week. She buys these shoes from wholesale shops around town. Lukia uses public means to go to and from work. She rents her business premises for 100,000 per month and sells retail and wholesale. Lukia sells to an average of 15 customers a day and has been in this business for the last fifteen years. Lukia is servicing her sixteenth loan, working all along with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to starting buying directly from Nairobi. She also aspires to build rental houses.

loans.use: To start buying her goods from Nairobi.

loans.name: Mrs. Noeurn Vean Village Bank Group

texts.en: Sixteen people living in Saeprambei village in Kampong Cham province make up this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Noeurn V., the 45-year-old village bank president, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Her husband, Mr. Sorn S., is a laborer who has only a little salary to support his family. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Noeurn V. decided to ask for a loan to purchase grocery goods to re-sell to earn more income. She has three children who are laborers in different positions.

loans.use: To purchase grocery goods to re-sell to earn more income.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: El Sr. A., trabaja con Emprender desde el año pasado inició con los microcréditos por recomendación de una cliente de la institución. Se dedica al transporte urbano de pasajero, actividad con la cual lleva día a día el sustento al hogar, su esposa es tejedora de mantas que vende en los mercados y ferias de la ciudad allá tambien es cliente de Emprender y de la misma manera aporta a la economía familiar ambos viven en una humilde casita junto a sus dos pequeños hijos quienes estan en la escuela. Todos colaboran con la limpieza y el orden en el hogar. En esta oportunidad solicitó este crédito para reparar su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mr. A. has been working with Emprender since last year. He started with microcredit on the recommendation of another client of the institution. A. works transporting people within the city, which covers the day-to-day costs of keeping a home. His wife weaves blankets and sells them in local markets. She is also a client of Emprender and the two live in a humble house with their two small children, who attend school. They all work to keep the house clean and orderly. A. is asking for a loan to repair his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repairs

loans.name: Simino Kossiwa

texts.fr: Etant une femme dynamique et travailleuse, cette dame a commencé à exercer depuis 2007 le commerce de maïs et de charbons de bois, le dynamisme dont elle fait preuve faite qu’elle est très connue dans son commerce, le stock dont elle dispose actuellement est presque épuisé, elle a déjà obtenu de crédit de WAGES, elle sollicite son second crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 03 sacs de charbons de bois et 05 sacs de maïs. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants, son mari est militaire. Avec le revenu de son commerce elle participe aux charges du foyer.
texts.en:
As a dynamic and hard-working woman, this lady began in 2007 to sell maize and charcoal. She is well-known in her sector and thus, the stock that she has presently is almost expended. She has already had one loan from WAGES and is now requesting her second to buy 3 sacks of charcoal and 5 sacks of maize for re-sale. She is married and has 2 children; her husband is a soldier. With the income from her little business, she participates in supporting her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize and charcoal for re-sale

loans.name: Barno

texts.ru: Зайниддинова  Барно женщина , 64 лет , замужем имеет троих детей. Она занимается бизнесом ,продажи нижнего женского белья и ночнушек. По завозу товаров её помогает её муж, и сын. Товар привозят с города Истаравшана, с оптового рынка. Барно хочет получив кредит увеличить товар весене- летнего ассортимента. Её бизнес увеличился за время кредитования, она кредитуется с 2007 года. Барно одна из положительных клиентов Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Barno Z. is a 64 year old woman, she is married and has three daughters. Her business is the sale of women’s underwear and nightgowns. Her husband and son help her to source her products. They bring them from the wholesale market in Istaravshan. Barno would like to take out a loan to increase her spring-summer selection. Her business has increased during the time that she has been a borrower since 2007. Barno is one of the good clients of MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase underwear and nightgowns for sale

loans.name: Delgermaa

texts.en: Delgermaa O. lives with her husband and four children between the ages of 11 and 17 in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her four children are all high school students. Delgermaa has a small business selling dairy products. Her husband helps in her business. Since 2000, she has been visiting herder families and purchasing their dairy products such as milk, cheese, cream and curds. She brings them to the local food market and resells them at a profit. Her husband drives his car from family to family to purchase dairy products whenever more is needed. Since 2000, her business capital has increased from 450,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT. In the future, she hopes to create a wholesale market for dairy products in her town. She requests a loan to purchase more dairy products for her business.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.en: Pascuala D., 59 years old, engages in peanut vending.  She lives in Pinig, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Her husband works in their village as a janitor.  Pascuala applied for a loan worth PHP 5,000.00 to purchase peanuts, brown sugar, cooking oil and cellophane.  Her business helps with their daily expenses.  She delivers her finished product to Dumalinao town every market day.  She plans to expand her peanut delivery in Pagadian City in order to generate more income.

loans.use: Purchase 3 sacks of peanuts, 10 kls of brown sugar, cooking oil

loans.name: Ana Lizeth

texts.es: Ana lizeth S. R. vive en el municipio de Ilopango ubicado en e departamento de San Salvador. Ana vive con esposo y sus hijos Jessica de 14 años, Ángela de 9 años y el pequeño Saulito de 11 meses de edad. Ana posee una tienda hace cinco años, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, la tienda se encuentra ubicada dentro de su casa. Ana solicita un crédito para surtir la tienda con otra variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana Lizeth S. R. lives in the municipality of Ilopango, located in the district of San Salvador. Ana lives with her husband and her children: Jessica (14), Ángela (9), and little Saulito (11 months).

Ana has had a store for five years, where she sells basic necessities. The store is located within her home.

Ana is requesting a loan in order to stock her store with more of a variety of goods to offer to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her store

loans.name: Good Hope Masika Joan Group

texts.en:
M. Joan is 32 years old and married with four children who are going to school. She also looks after three dependents.

M. Joan has been running her business of selling beans so far for two years. She is using the loan to purchase bags of beans, adding to her stock for sale. She is an active business lady whose dream is to build a residential house.

loans.use: To purchase bags of beans to add to her stock

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia Loko M. is a 31year old mother of 2 boys, aged 10 and 7 years. She is a single mother and lives with her sons in Mkoroshoni, in the Kilifi district. Patricia is a business lady who sells a variety of clothes and shoes for both men and women. She has been in that business for 4 years. She also supplements her income through charcoal which she sells in the same area.

This will be Patricia's second loan from KADET and with this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings, she plans to increase her clothes and shoes stock in her shop. 

In the future she hopes to diversify her business further by opening a retail shop, selling different household items. She also hopes to own her own house and to stop paying rent.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes supplies for her shop

loans.name: Yedoukoua

texts.fr: Cette femme  est mariée et mère de 02 enfants, elle vit avec son époux et ses 02 enfants dans le quartier de gblinkomé à lomé. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de produits d'alimentation générale. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé, pour attirer plus de clients,elle réduit  son prix de vente, ainsi elle réalise plus de profits. Voulant rehausser son stock elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter  3 sacs de riz, 5 cartons de savons,3 bidons d'huile rouge et divers produits d'alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of 2 children. She lives with her husband and her two children in the Gblinkomé district in Lomé. Her business is selling groceries. She stocks up in Lomé. In order to attact more customers, she lowers her sales prices, and in that way she makes more profit. Wishing to expand her inventory, she is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 3 sacks of rice, 5 cartons of soap, 3 jerrycans of red (palm) oil, and various other grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing grocery inventory

loans.name: Aeshboi

texts.ru: Эшбой Хочиев проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Эшбой вместе со своей семьей работает в колхозе. Он также более 8 лет занимается животноводством, откармливает и продает крупный и мелкий рогатый скот. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
Aeshboi H. lives in the Rumy district. He is 51 years old, married and has 6 children. Aeshboi and his family work at a collective farm. He also has been involved in animal husbandry for over 8 years. He raises and sells cattle and small livestock. He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a member of the Majengo borrower group in Kiboriloni, Kilimanjaro. She is 46 year old woman, she is widowed and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 28, 24, 22 years old.

Claudia has owned a grocery business selling drinks for 8 years, she works 16 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 300,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Claudia`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more drinks.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Claudia hopes to save money, pay school fees and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinkslike beer and soda

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina manages her own general store business which is located just in front of their house. At the age of 54, she still accepts laundry for additional income.  to meet the needs of their family.  Marina’s business is not continuously operated due shortage of revolving capital. Thus, she opted to request a loan of at least PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders to use as her additional revolving capital towards further development of her store. 

Marina is residing at the village of Roxas Naguilian, Isabela. She is married to Romeo, a farmer in their village.  They have three children: Richard, Ronnie and Romel. Richard and Ronnie are already married.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Fatuma's Group

texts.en:
N. Fatuma is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a hard-working and determined lady with a business of selling agricultural produce plus poultry at Samuuka Centre for 30 years. Fatuma says that her business is doing well, except that at times, she is faced with the scarcity of produce to sell because of bad seasons and this affects her cash flow. She is able to earn 80,000/= on average as profit each week and this helps her to save for future developments. She has been successful because of the use of her loans to acquire quality produce as well as because of good customer care.

Fatuma has a dream of becoming a wholesale supplier of agricultural produce so that she could be able to sell more plus educating all her children to the highest level of education. At the moment, Fatuma needs a loan to help recapitalize her business for a steady supply of agricultural products to her customers.

loans.use: Recapitalizing her business for a steady supply of agricultural produce to her customers

loans.name: Nekaruut A Group

texts.en:
Nekaruut A is a group of seven farmers in Merbaun Village, Nekaruut Sub-Village, West Amarasi Sub-District, Kupang District of East Nusa, Tenggara Province. Merbaun Village is situated about 42 km from Kupang City.

The group is led by Herman T., a 36-year-old married man with three adorable children: Astri T., 14, in the second grade of junior high school; Zamrud, 5, in kindergarten; and Maria, 1. Herman and his family have lived in Merbaun Village for years. As the head of his family, Herman is responsible for meeting their daily needs. Therefore, he has been working as a truck driver for 14 years, usually delivering sand and stones for his customers. The income that he earns from this work is unstable as it depends on orders from customers. Besides working as a truck driver, Herman cultivates banana and coconuts on his farm, but he is only able to sell these products every six months. By selling agricultural products, he can only generate a small amount of income. Herman realizes that his children are growing up and they will need more and more money, both for their education as well as their daily needs.

Herman needs to find another way to support his family. He saw that his neighbors had joined the Cattle Fattening Program of Kiva partner TLM and after several cycles of this program they were able to better provide for their families. He got information from a relative about the TLM Cattle Fattening Program, which assists poor farmers in West Timor by providing a loan to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. Herman thinks this program is a good way to improve his family's standard of living. So after discussing it with his nearest neighbors, they decided to form a group, called Nekaruut A.

Herman is requesting a loan of 3,400,000 IDR to buy young cattle to be fattened over a 12-month period. The other group members are also requesting loans to buy young cattle to fatten, as they also want to provide a better life for their beloved families.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Mean

texts.en: Mean P., 27, is married with four children. She resides in Kandal Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she  raises pigs for sale, earning approximately US $5 per day. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner. Her husband is a middle man who buys bananas from the local farmers from the village and sells them to markets in the town, earning an income of US $5 per day. Mrs. P. and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and to generate a better income. Therefore, P. is asking for a loan of US $400 to purchase bananas and pig food to expand their current businesses.

loans.use: buy bananas and pig food

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 40 years-old and married with four children, two of whom are attending school. He runs a computer shop in Kitengela, a small town near Nairobi. He provides photocopying, typesetting and design services in his shop and is in his fourth year of business. He also earns some extra income keeping livestock. He describes himself as humble, focused, and self-motivated.  He has requested this loan of Kes. 40,000 from Kiva partner Faulu to install Internet connectivity in his shop. In the future, he hopes to be a leading service provider in the area, have good equipment and offer efficient service.

loans.use: To install internet.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 21 years of age and he is single. He lives in Musanze, a region of Ruhengeri, in the Northern Province of Rwanda.

Fabien has been a proven entrepreneur in the business of selling household items such as saucepans, flasks, jugs, stoves, etc. He has run his business for four successful years and employs two people from his community. Every day except Saturday he starts his work at 6 a.m. and works until 6 p.m.

Fabien is requesting his first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing more household items such as saucepans, flasks, stoves, etc. He believes that he must offer more products to his customers to better satisfy their growing demand for these items.

Fabien plans to save a portion of any profits he earns to build a stable foundation for his business and also to start saving for a family one day!

loans.use: To buy additional household items to sell

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr. Pablo tiene 48 años de edad y vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Tacagua, se encuentra casado con doña Juliana, con la que tiene 3 hijos, los dos se dedican a la venta de perfumes, actividad que lo realizan de manera ambulante, pues tienen clientes tanto en la zona de Villa Fatima, El Tejar y la Ceja de El Alto.

El crédito solicitado es para comprar más mercaderia por temporada de navidad, mercaderia que lo comprara en Yacuiba, pues le permite tener un mayor margen de ganancia por unidad de producto.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo is 48 years old and lives in his own home in the Alto Tacagua zone. He is married to Juliana with whom he has three children. They both sell perfume from door to door. They have customers in the Villa Fatima, El Tejar and the Ceja de El Alto zones. He is soliciting a loan to buy more merchandise for the Christmas season. He buys his merchandise in Yacuiba which allows him to have a greater profit margin per unit of product.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume

loans.name: Mainifo

texts.en:
Mainifo T. is 20 and married with 2 children (ages 4 and 8).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting taro for sale.  Mainifo has 4 years of experience in this business.  Mainifo needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 120 tala or US $50 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Mainifo joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Mainifo's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Mainifo T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated. For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Adalat Semeteeva`s Group

texts.en:
Adalat is 50 years old. She has been married for more than 25 years and has 3 sons. Her husband and elder 2 sons work at a construction company in Russia and regularly send money to their family. Her youngest son is a high school student. Adalat has a very rare business for women in Central Asia; she is a taxi driver. She usually provides transportation services to her neighbors, friends and relatives. It all began in 2008 when she used money sent to her from Russia to buy a second hand Mercedes for $4000. At the present time, she earns about $150 per month. Last year she changed her car and bought a Toyota for $5000 because it is more comfortable and economical. She will use this loan to buy a tire and do some minor car painting. In the future, Adalat plans to find a constant job; previously, she worked in the city’s educational department.  

Mairamkan, 40, is a mother of five children. She breeds livestock and also sells milk products. She is trying to provide her children with the best education possible. She is planning to buy one cow to increase milk production. 

Idris, 34, provides transportation services. He is married with 4 children. His wife sells rice and his two older children are students. This loan will be used to buy additional rice for his wife’s business in order to increase turnover. 

Kizdarkan is 48 years old. She is a widow with 5 children. Kizdarkan breeds livestock. Her children also take an active role in this business.  Now she has 2 cows and will use this loan to buy a milk cow.  More milk means a bigger income for her family. 


This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-P's concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a tire and do some minor car painting

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La Sra. Antonia tiene 50 años y  esta casada con el Sr. Carlos M. D. 52 años, cuentan con 4 hijos todos ellos trabajando actualmente.
 La familia se dedica actualmente a la venta en  D. ropas en su domicilio, actualmente cuenta con una buena cantidad D. clientes y la venta lo realiza saliendo a recorrer por los alrededores D. la ciudad.
Le gustaría  abrir en su domicilio un salón D. ventas D. ropas ya que le es incomodo recorrer, y por poseer varios clientes.
texts.en:
Antonia, age 50, is married to Carlos M., age 52. They have four children who are currently working. At present the family sells clothes. They have a good amount of customers, and they make sales by going to the outskirts of the city. She would like to open a place to sell clothes in her home because it is uncomfortable traveling to their various customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes like t-shirts, dresses, blouses, and others

loans.name: Abylkasymova Zamira`s Group

texts.en:
Zamira is a woman with a hard fate. Her husband died many years ago and, unfortunately, she doesn't have any children. She lives with her brother's family. She works in a local school where she is a teacher. On weekends, she deals with animal sales in the local market. This loan will be used to buy cattle to resell later. Now she has eight cattle as trade assets. 

Bermet is 55 years old. She is also a widow with four children. Her elder daughter studies at the university. She deals with vegetable sales in Nookat. She sells mainly potatoes. This loan will be used to buy a cow. Her sons will help their mother look after it and she will sell milk and milk products. 

Busara, 52, has two sons. Both of them are pupils. She is involved in livestock breeding. She will use this loan to buy cattle to feed. She started this business four years ago with one sheep. Now she has a few cattle. 

Gulay is 44 years old. She lives with her sister and nieces. She works in the local library. In her free time, she looks after her cattle. She will buy cattle with her loan. Her average income from her business is $100 US.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Omolara

texts.en:
Omolara, age 49, lives in Lagos, Nigeria. She is married and has one child. She sells drinks to make a living and has been managing this business for over 20 years. 

She wants to expand her business, which is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 100, 000 to purchase drinks in larger quantities to sell. She hopes to have a car for her business in future so that she can supply drinks at wholesale to her customers at their individual places of business.

Omolara is very supportive of her husband in terms of providing food, clothing, and so on for the children. She intends to repay her loan by its due date. She expresses her gratitude to all lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Ange

texts.en:
Ange is 34 years old and is married with three children who are 2, 9 and 12 years old.

Ange struggles by owning a barber shop where she earns money for her daily living. This is her fifth year in this business, even though her earned profits are still too low to expand her business as she wishes.

Ange is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her barbershop by purchasing some additional equipment, mainly clippers, etc.. This, in turn, will help her to increase the number of her customers as well as her profits.

If successful, Ange will continue to provide all the best needs of her children as well as building a secure future for them.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for her barber shop

loans.name: Ndock

texts.fr: Ndock D. est une femme de 65 ans, elle est veuve sans enfant. Elle est depuis 5 ans membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU et y a reçu 10 fois de suite de crédit. Elle est vendeuse de bétail, son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 moutons qu'elle engraisse pour revendre au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Ndock D. is a 65-year old woman, a widow without children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois of Keur Ngalgou for five years and has obtained ten successive loans. She is selling livestock; her new loan will allow her to purchase ten sheep for fattening before reselling at the local biweekly fairs. Her goal is to be able to support herself.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her livestock business

loans.name: Aboubakal

texts.en:
Aboubakal is 35 years old and married with two children who are 3 and 6 years old.  Aboubakal is well known in the business of selling spare parts and this is his third successful year in the business.  Aboubakal works from 7 am to 8 pm every day.

Aboubakal needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that he can increase the size of his business by adding a larger quantity of different spare parts, mainly those used on cars of high level (Mercedes Benz). With this loan, Aboubakal hopes that his profits will increase to the extent the he is expecting, so as to create some sources of income as well as more jobs for people in his community.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for sale

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 57 años, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde muy pequeño se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, junto con su familia. Y en la actualidad trabaja activamente en estas labores, cultiva maca (raíz con propiedades curativas) y papa (tubérculo peruano), además cría diversos animales, pero sobretodo la alpaca, pues es la adecuada para el tipo de clima  de la comunidad donde vive. Diariamente lleva a pastear a sus alpacas en las amplias planicies de su tierra natal, luego comercializa la lana que trasquila de sus animales, y obtiene regulares ganancias; en ocasiones también vende su carne. Las cosechas de sus productos también los comercializa, sobre todo la maca que le trae mayores ganancias. Para el futuro tiene planes de aumentar la  cantidad de sus animales y también desea sembrar en mayor cantidad.Es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete será muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Antonio invertirá el dinero solicitado en  pagar  a ayudantes   para sus cosechas, y también comprará medicinas que necesita para sus alpacas.
texts.en:
Antonio is 57 years old, and lives with his wife and three children in a house that he owns. Ever since he was very young, he has worked in the fields with his family. Nowadays he grows maca (a root with curative properties) and papa (a Peruvian tuber). He also raises various animals, above all alpacas which are the best suited to the climate where he lives. Every day he takes his alpacas to graze in the ample plains of his homeland, and he regularly shears and sells their wool for profit. Sometimes he also sells their meat. He also sells the harvests from his crop, from which the maca is the most profitable. His plans for the future include increasing both the number of animals he raises, and the number of plants that he sows. This is Antonio's fifth loan with MFP, and he promises to be very responsible with his payments. He also wishes to thank everyone who has made possible this loan, which will be very useful for the further progress of his business. Antonio will use the requested money to pay farmhands to help in his fields, and to buy medicines for his alpacas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy medicine for his alpacas and pay farmhands.

loans.name: Tita

texts.es: Tita tiene 50 años, vive en casa propia, en compañía de su pareja y su hija Selene de 8 años. Hace más de un año que empezó a vender productos de belleza, ya que una vecina le incentivo en la venta por estar en este trabajo. Con el tiempo ha logrado a ganar experiencia, ahora le es rentable el negocio, pues parte de su éxito se debe en el buen trato hacia sus clientes, también conoce los productos que ofrece y eso le da mucha confianza a la clientela. En un futuro ha pensado seguir en este rubro hasta convertirse en líder y así acceder a las ventajas de este negocio, ya que sus ingresos aumentarían al mismo tiempo su experiencia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para así tenerlo en stock.
texts.en:
Tita is 50 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and eight year old daughter Selene. A year and a half ago, she began selling beauty products after a neighbor convinced her to start this business. Over time, she gained experience and now has a profitable business. Part of her success is attributed to the good service she provides to her customers. She is also knowledgeable about the products she offers and demonstrates great confidence with her customers. In the future, she hopes to remain in this field until she becomes a leader and has access to the advantages that come with the business. She will continue to gain more experience as her income increase.

This is her first loan with MFP. Tita promises to be prompt with all of her payments. The loan she requested will be used to buy a larger quantity of beauty products so that she will have them in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of cosmetics

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita L. is from the village of Lalawan Dicayas. She is 42 years old, married and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Rita owns and operates a business that provides repair services to community members.  Rita has been in business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rita joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Rita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC.  Rita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP to buy electrical materials. This loan will be her 4th from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

--------------------------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Buy electrical materials.

loans.name: Isac

texts.es: Isac tiene una pequeña bodega hace 5 años que le permite cubrir los gastos en casa  pero como es un hombre emprendedor diariamente compra y vende pasteles en un mercado grande de Vitarte en donde de forma ambulante los vende. Sus 3 hijos que aun están en el colegio apoyan con este trabajo. A Isac le gustaría ver a sus 3 hijos con estudios profesionales y por eso trabaja día a día, Además tiene como objetivo tener su propia panadería. Isaac agradece los el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
For the last five years Isac has had a small shop which helps him meet his household expenses. But, since he is an entrepreneurial man, he also works every day as a street vendor buying and selling cakes in the main market of Vitarte. His three high school-aged children help him with this work. Isac would like to see his three children be educated as professionals and this is why he works hard every day. He also would like to own his own bakery. Isac is grateful for the support of this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients

loans.name: Exito Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Éxito lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, estordas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Araceli U. quien desde hace ocho años vende cosmético de diferentes marcas. Ella tiene dos hijos de 14 y 8 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente.
Las otras integrantes son Yolanda N. quien produce y comercializa tiste, pozol, pinolillo etc. y María Magdalena U. M. quien es costurera desde hace 20 años.
texts.en:
The El Éxito (Success) group is made up of three hard working, dedicated and enterprising people. One of them is Araceli U. who has sold various brands of cosmetics for the last 8 years. She has two children, who are 14 and 8 years of age, for whom she works hard. The other group members are: Yolanda N. who makes and sells tiste (drink made with tortilla, cacao and sugar), pozol (drink made with corn and cacao), pinolillo (cornmeal and cacao-based drink), etc. and María Magdalena U. M. who has been a seamstress for the last 20 years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cosmetics.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria S. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 47 years old. Gloria is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Gloria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. She says she is thankful to have a source of income and hopes for her farm to grow more.

Gloria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gloria is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the second loan taken out by Gloria from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and improve their living conditions. 

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years.  Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines.  In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring.  CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna J. is from the town of Banga. She is 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. Rosanna is a farmer and helps her husband plant and harvest rice crops. She also plants fruit trees like "rambutan," a kind of lychee. She also makes food that she sells in the community. Like other mothers, she wants to see her children be professionals someday.

Rosanna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizer. She will also buy ingredients for cooking. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosanna from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and ingredients for cooking the food she sells

loans.name: Ligia Aracely

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

Tiene 55 años pero tiene muchas energías así es la señora Ligia, está casada hace 36 años y de esta linda relación tuvieron 5 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero dos de ellos aún viven con ella en su casa.

Tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior de todo tipo, además de camisetas deportivas, ella junto con su esposo atienden su local que tienen en su propia casa, trabajan desde las 8am hasta las 6pm, venden al por mayor a comerciantes de la zona a los cuales les deja a crédito y a buen precio. La mercadería las adquieren en Guayaquil ciudad a la que viajan una vez al mes y en otros casos solo hacen los pedidos y se los envían.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar más mercadería, ya que tiene muchos productos entregados y tiene muchos pedidos por entregar.

 Sus metas son seguir adelante y comprar un buen carro.
texts.en:
The community bank named May 3 meets every two weeks in the district of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. The location is known for its commerce, for its traditional feast days of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the generally happy population. Ligia is 55 years old but she is full of energy. She has been married for 36 years and from this beautiful marriage came 5 children. They are all grown but two are still living at home. She has a business selling undergarments of all kinds but she also sells t-shirts. She and her husband manage the store located in a section of their home. They work from 8am to 6pm. They sell in wholesale to retailers in the region. They complete their sales in credit and they always offer their merchandise at a good price. They purchase their merchandise in the city of Guayaquil where they travel once a month or more often if they receive special orders. This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise. She has filled many orders and she still has many orders outstanding. Her goal is to advance and to purchase a good car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments and t-shirts.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette is 33 years old and she is still single.  Antoinette is a successful entrepreneur who has owned a nursery school since 2005.  She is very proud of her business as it allows her to provide for the basic needs of her family.

Antoinette needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  Once given this loan, Antoinette will buy some equipment like chairs and renovate the classrooms.  If successful, Antoinette will start planning how to build some other rooms so that she can find her business being expanded.

loans.use: To buy some school equipment

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok O. is a 43-year-old married mother who currently lives in the best territory of Phnom Penh, the capital in Cambodia. 

Mrs. Sok O. owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on this land, such as cabbages, cucumbers, and morning glories, which she will sell to buyers every three months when the plants mature. 

Her husband is a fisherman and has been selling a few fresh fish in the local busy market for many years. Currently, the fishing is temporarily interrupted because the fishing tool is broken. Because of that, Mrs. Sok O. requested a loan in order to buy additional fishing equipment.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Mariatu. She is married and has 1 child, aged 3 months. In 1995, Mariatu established her business of selling plastic bowls, sets of pans, and food items. She began this business to generate more income to help her husband provide livelihood for their family. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 800,000 SLL every month. She needs a loan of 3,000,000 SLL to buy more inventory.

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Mariatu plans to buy piece of land. She thanks you for supporting her.

loans.use: To buy assorted rubbers bowls, sets of pans, dishes, and palm oil.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz es socia del Banco Comunal Tu Angel Lucy, tiene 41 años, es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos (16-13-11-8). Maria Luz, se dedica a venta de polos y buzos para niños y adultos. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en comprar su mercadería, tiene demanda.
Maria Luz, antes se dedicaba a la venta de especería en forma ambulatoria, pero no se vendía a veces se malograba, decidió cambia por la venta de buzos y polos porque tiene bastante demanda sobre todo los fines de mes, sus compradores potenciales son del Programa Juntos.
Su sueño es abrir una tienda grande y ampliar más su mercadería, construir su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
M.ía Luz, 41, is a member of the Tu Ángel Lucy (Your Angel Lucy) communal bank.  She has a live-in partner and four children (16, 13, 11 and 8 years old).  M.ía Luz sells children and adult t-shirts and sweatshirts.  She will use the loan to buy merchandise; she has demand.

M.ía Luz used to sell spices itinerantly but sometimes she didn’t sell and went through hard times.  She decided to change to the sale of t-shirts and sweatshirts because she has quite a bit of demand, especially at the end of the month.  Her potential buyers are from the Programa Juntos (Government funded assistance program for the extreme poor).

Her dream is to open a big store and expand her inventory, to build her own house and that her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy sweatshirts.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla a 27 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur de profession.  Elle est revendeuse de maïs et compte dans cette activité près de 12 ans déjà.  Elle est née à Tabligbo mais habite à akodessewa. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Lomé pour se procurer plus de marchandises. Elle demande un prêt pour faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante.
texts.en: Abla is 27 years old and married to a man who is a driver by profession. Abla sells maize and has been in this business for nearly 12 years. She was born in Tabligbo, but now she lives in Akodessewa. She purchases her supplies in the towns around Lomé, in order to get more goods. She is requesting this loan in order to better meet increasing demand.

loans.use: To purchase maize

loans.name: Harrison Sirikia

texts.en:
Harrison, 28 years old, has been farming in Naivasha since 2003.  He rotates between planting cabbage and wheat.

Harrison was introduced to KADET by a friend, and this will be his second loan.  He paid his previous loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) in good time.  He plans to plant wheat and buy fertilizer with the new loan.

In the future, Harrison hopes to buy his own farming equipment and save on having to rent equipment every time he wants to plant or harvest.

loans.use: To plant wheat and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lodivina

texts.en:
Lodivina S. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old. Lodivina is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Lodivina owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, instant noodles & snacks in the local community. Lodivina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lodivina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lodivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Lodivina is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like beverages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lodivina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products, like beverages to sell

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es: Benedicta, de 58 años, es una valerosa madre soltera de 2 hijos, los cuales viven en diferentes lugares del país. Pero ella vive con su papa Honorato, de 83 años de edad, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Cochas. Hace algún tiempo está laboriosa mujer, se dedicaba a la venta de coca, donde comercializaba al por mayor, con la licencia correspondiente, del estado. Ahora ella regresó a Tarma, para poder cuidar a su papá que está delicado de salud; a quien ayuda en sus sembríos de papa, habas, arveja y maíz, los que cuida con mucho cuidado, porque sabe que de ello depende sus ganancias. En cada cosecha Benedicta, lleva a vender su producción a la capital. Pero el mayor pasatiempo de ella, es la crianza de sus 45 cabezas de reses y sus 50 cuyes, los cuales los alimenta para luego vender su carne al por mayor en el mercado central de Tarma. Ahora quiere sembrar en mayores cantidades y cuidar a su papá. Es el décimo crédito con MFP, y como secretaria de su banco comunal, se siente dichosa de poder pertenecer a una asociación antigua que trabaja para el éxito de sus integrantes. De obtener el crédito solicitado, podrá adquirir varios sacos de semilla de arveja, los cuales esparcirá en sus terrenos agrícolas.
texts.en:
58 year-old Benedicta is a courageous single mother.  She has two children who live in different parts of the country.  Benedicta lives with her dad, 83 year-old Honorato, in their own home which is located in the town of Cochas.

Some time ago, this hard-working woman used to sell coca leaf wholesale, with the corresponding state license.   Now she has returned to Tarma so that she can take care of her dad who is not in good health.  She helps him with his potato, bean, pea and corn crops, taking good care of them because she knows that their profits depend on it.  Each harvest season, Benedicta takes her crops to sell in the capital.  However, her biggest pastime is raising her 45 heads of cattle and 50 guinea pigs which she feeds so that she can then sell their meat wholesale in Tarma central market.  Benedicta would like to sow her crops in larger quantities and take care of her father.

This is Benedicta's tenth loan with MFP and, as secretary of her community bank, she feels lucky to be able to work for a long-standing association that works for the success of its members.  She will use her loan to acquire several sacks of pea seed which she will sow on her land.

loans.use: To buy sacks of pea seed

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem P. is a married woman who has always done housework as a daily routine. She is a good housewife and a good mother of six children. Her 
main activities include cooking  meals for all members the family as well as washing clothes, cleaning house, caring her kids, managing the property.

 Her husband is a fisherman, and earns a profit about $5 per day which is used to meet family expenses. This couple are blessed with six children, four of whom are single, and two are married. They have two children working  at the main factory and having a proper salary every month. Khem P. says that she has one child who wishes to go on and study at the university level but Khem P. has no cash to support him.  Khem P. would like to request a loan to be used to pay the school cost.

loans.use: To pay for school costs.

loans.name: Emiliano

texts.es:
Emiliano es soltero y tiene de 68 años de edad, reside junto familia en el caserío Santa Elena del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Emiliano se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura. El cría ganado ovino y aves de corral en un espacio que tiene cerca a su domicilio. Él los alimenta con pastos naturales y, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes y vecinos de la zona en donde él reside, de esta manera solventa sus gastos económicos y ayuda a su madre.

El desea adquirir más animales para ampliar su negocio y comprar alimento balanceado que le permita venderlos a buen precio e incrementar sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Emiliano es una persona bastante trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
texts.en:
Emiliano, 68, is single living with his family in Santa Elena in the Tambogrande farming area located in Piura region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.

Emiliano works in activities associated with farming.  He raises sheep and barnyard fowl in an area near his house.  He feeds them natural grasses and when they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants and neighbors in his area.  This way he meets his personal expenses and helps his mother.

He wants to acquire more animals to expand his business and to buy nutritionally balanced feed that will make it possible for him to sell them at a good price and increase his sales.  He has, therefore, deemed it advisable to request a 500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help him reach his objective.

Emiliano is quite a hard working person.  His greatest wish is to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy animals and nutritionally balanced feed.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia L. is a married woman who lives in Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business.
