Nuestra socia Ruth empezó  su negocio con la ayuda de una amiga, ella vende marcianos y gelatinas,  aunque al principio no obtenía muchas ganancias, entonces decidió ampliar su negocios así que ahora vende diferentes bebidas y con la ganancias de sus ventas puede mantener y solventar los gastos en casa.
Yeny es una socia que viaja constantemente, ella trae frutos de la selva peruana para venderlos en su casa asi puede aportar con los gastos en casa.
Los socios agradecen el préstamo y prometen cumplir con los acuerdos del grupo.
 seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
This is the first loan for the communal bank "Asociación de Todas las Sangres.” The members have a variety of economic activities with which they support their families. With a lot of effort, Lucy opened a store a year ago. With the earnings from her business she is able to support her 3 children and move forward with her plans. Our member Ruth started her business with the help of a friend. She sells frozen fruit juice and gelatin snacks. Although at first she did not have very good earnings, she then decided to expand her business so that now she sells a variety of drinks, and with the earnings from her sales she is able to cover the household expenses. Yeny is a member who travels constantly. She takes fruit from the Peruvian rainforest to sell from her home. In this way she can help with the household expenses. The members are grateful for this loan and promise to make their payments according to their group agreement. EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Maria Gerardina

texts.es:
La señora María Enríquez  pertenece al banco comunal Corazón de Jesús y vive en el sector del Valle, en su mayor parte su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pero los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra socia es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla tiene 62 años de edad y es viuda desde que tenia 31 años, su esposo ha falleció por consecuencia de su trabajo ya que ha sabido realizar trabajos en paja toquilla y azufre llegando este material por absorción al corazón y matándolo de un infarto. Ha concebido 7 hijos, 6 hijos son casados excepto un hijo quien es padre soltero y le ayuda en la casa con los gastos, viven en una casa arrendada.

 Doña María se ha roto la mano por un accidente pero se encuentra recuperándose de una manera satisfactoria, se dedica a la agricultura,  también a la venta de aves y chanchos, anteriormente lavaba ropa pero ahora por su lesión no lo puede hacer, una amiga le invito a ser a parte del banco comunal hace 6 años y todo este tiempo el dinero le ha beneficiado para poder incrementar mas animales para su negocio y también para comprar los alimentos necesarios en su casa. Con el nuevo crédito que recibirá de parte de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento y mas animales, su sueño es  seguir manteniendo su salud para trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Enríquez belongs to the Corazón de Jesús [Heart of Jesus] Communal Bank and lives in the Valle area. Most people in this region work in agriculture and cattle ranching but many young people have left for the cities in search of better job opportunities. This bank member is a happy and unassuming woman. She is 62 years old and was widowed at age 31. Her husband died from work-related injuries. He worked with palm fibers and sulfur, which was absorbed through his skin and eventually caused a heart attack. Maria has 7 children, 6 of whom are married. The 7th is a single father who lives with her in a rented house and helps out with everyday expenses. Maria broke her hand in an accident but is recovering well. She works in the fields and sells birds and pigs. She used to work washing clothes but is no longer able to do so because of her injury. A friend invited her to be part of the communal bank 6 years ago and the loans she has gotten have helped her to be able to increase the number of animals she sells and also to buy food for her household. With this new loan that she will receive through ESPOIR [the Kiva field partner] she will buy more food and more animals. Her dream is to stay in good health so that she can keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, pigs, and food.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe Djiguisseme 2 sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Nangola, un des villages de la préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. 
Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz, l’arachide et le petit mil. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt de campagne et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, Matou Koné compte acheter les intrants avant la hausse des prix, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir sa superficie culturale estimée à 3 hectares environs.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village de Nangola et environnants et dans la ville de Dioïla après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the Djiguisseme 2 group are married women, on average 34 years old with four children. Most live in polygamous families in Nangola, one of the villages in the Dioïla Prefecture of the Koulikouro region, which belongs to the 2nd administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to better organise their activities at the start of the winter campaign. The crops they speculate on are rice, ground nuts and millet, among others. This is their fifth campaign loan, and all previous loans were well reimbursed. With this new loan, Matou Koné intends to buy seedlings and fertiliser before prices increase, small farming equipment and pay labor costs to cultivate her arable land, estimated at 3 hectares (approx. 7.5 acres). The crops are sold after harvest in Nangola and the adjoining area, and in the town of Dioïla, to both men and women customers. They hope to reach an average profit of 40,000 FCFA per campaign.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seedlings and fertiliser, small farming equipment and labor costs

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras 4 Group

texts.en:
Bibiana is the coordinator of her group Mujeres luchadoras 4 (Fighting women). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are building her house, being a single mom and wanting to give her family a better home.

Bibiana is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying blankets, clothes and shoes. She will use the profits to change some windows in her house. In the future, she wants to improve her house and she is very sure that with Esperanza and the loans she will have a better business and a safer home.

This Esperanza associate’s story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Puerto Plata, a port town on the north coast where the economy is based on tourism. . This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy clothes, blankets and shoes

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
The fishing business has brought pleasure to Helen’s family. Because of its profits, she has been able to support her family’s needs. Being a good mother, Helen has always wanted to support her children in whatever career they would be taking to better their own personal life.  Aside from Helen’s fishing business, financed by the loan she received from ASHI, she also has a farming business.  This is her way of saving her profits to support the needs of her family, especially to pay for her children’s education until college.

Her husband’s support of her fishing business is Helen’s inspiration to keep growing her business despite the challenges of poverty.  Over time, Helen has been able to purchase a fishing boat for her husband to manage and use for fishing.  Meanwhile, Helen is the one who sells his fish directly to people in local community and nearby town of Jala-jala, Rizal.

With that, Helen is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to purchase additional fishing equipment to catch more fish to sell and support the maintenance of her family's farming business. This would help their business grow, and make more profit, which will enable her to support her ambition in life.

Helen has been an ASHI member since 2005. Her family is very thankful that she has an opportunity to improve their standard of living through the income of the fishing and fish selling businesses she has established with the support of the loans she has requested.

The attached picture of Helen was taken July 14,2010 with her supportive husband, Jesus S. J..

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment and to support the maintenance of the family farming business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia L. is from the village of Bayabo East, Tumauini. She is 57 years old. Cecilia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Cecilia owns & operates a motorcycle transport business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation to local community members. Cecilia is just starting this business.

In 2010, Cecilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cecilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to maintain her motorcycle. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cecilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to maintain a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice and peppers to resell

loans.name: Sothach

texts.en:
Mrs. Sothach H. (in the photo), 50, is a widow with two children--one son and one daughter. Her son is a driver and her daughter is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb.

Sothach has been renting out a space in her house to garment factory workers for ten years. Because her house is located near a garment factory, it’s good for her to operate this business. Some rooms of her house are old and broken down, so Sothach is requesting her first loan of US$ 1,000 to make the necessary repairs.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Union Group

texts.en:
James M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Union. He is 55 years old and married. James has four children whose ages are between 11 and 21 years. He was only able to attend school through first grade due to financial constraints. 

For 12 years, he has been selling tailoring materials such as needles, thread, zips, cloth, etc., in the Chicken-soup Community Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 30,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more tailoring materials such as needles, thread, zips, cloth, etc. 

He describes himself as a good man whose dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring materials such as needles, thread, zips, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Gerlie

texts.en:
This is Gerlie C., 40, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Edwin C. and mother of two hard-working young adults and a toddler. By the grace of God, Gerlie has managed to support her older children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to meet their everyday expenses.

Gerlie operates a woodworking business. She designs and produces wooden furniture, craft items and displays from many different varieties of native wood. Most of what she produces is made of Narra, a truly special wood of the highest quality that comes from the Philippines’ national tree, Molave.

To help her continue the operations of her business, she is requesting a loan for 18,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more raw materials, and expects to earn a higher income as she expands her business. 
 
Gerlie dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, and always takes time to meet with other CCT members to share suggestions and information about their work.

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who meet each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more raw materials for a woodworking business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Comprar hilos de diferentes colores. (To purchase threads of different colors)

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Srta. Yolanda; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de muebles, ella vende muebles como sillas, camas y roperos en las feria de la ciudad de Cusco en un lugar llamado San Sebastian, ella trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar muebles al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank “Mercamueble”, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 29 years old and single. Yolanda divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling furniture. She sells furniture such as chairs, beds, and wardrobes at the city fair of Cusco in a place called San Sebastian. Yolanda works from 9am to 7pm. She wants to expand her business, so she is requesting a loan to buy furniture in bulk.

Yolanda is grateful to those who have helped fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: Purchase furniture in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. sells onions, tomatoes and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to stock more cans of cooking oil to sell. She is 30 years old and married to a farmer. She has three children, one of whom goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

loans.use: Stock more cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a widowed mother of seven, operates her "Jitegemee Dressmaking" business, where she offers tailoring and dressmaking services. She employs one person and has a combination of institutional and individual customers. She has been operating this business for ten years and is a member of Jitegemee Ufaulu SHG. 

Christine is requesting a loan of Kes 50,000 to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to become a millionaire in the future. When asked about Faulu Kenya, she says, "Faulu has taught me how to keep my records and deal with customers."  When asked about herself, she says, "I am good in business."

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: José Segundo Alfredo

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 39 años de edad, tiene tres hijos y reside junto a su familia en el el sector La Esperanza del distrito de Reque, una zona situada aproximadamente a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores pecuarias desde hace varios años. El cría vacas en la parte posterior de su domicilio y diariamente extrae la leche que producen para venderla a un acopiador y al público en general. Adicionalmente cría cuyes para consumo humano, la carne de estos animales es bastante estimada a nivel nacional y constituye uno de los elementos principales de la comida típica peruana, el comercializa estos animales entre los vecinos de su zona. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

José desea completar el monto que necesita para adquirir una nueva vaca de modo que pueda aumentar su producción y ventas, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is a 39 year-old father.  He has three children and lives with his family in the La Esperanza sector of Reque district.  This area is located approximately twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

José has been raising livestock for several years.  He raises cows out the back of his home and every day he milks his cows and sells the milk to a trader and the general public.  He also raises guinea pigs for human consumption.  The meat of these animals is quite well liked nationally and it is one of the main elements of traditional Peruvian cuisine.  He sells these animals to his neighbors.  José uses the profits he makes from these activities to get his family ahead financially.

José would like to complete the sum he needs to buy a new cow so that he can increase his production and sales.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To complete the sum he needs to buy a new cow

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa M. I. vive en la cabecera municipal del municipio de Axochiapan Morelos, México. Tiene 69 años, sin estudios elementales. Su préstamo lo va a utilizar para surtir de mercancías su negocio de venta de zapatos, ella vende los días sábados y domingos en la plaza principal de Axochiapan, vende calzado para dama y caballero. Tiene 3 años con su negocio y antes vendía comida en el mismo puesto del mercado, pero después le comentaron que era mejor negocio la venta de zapatos y decidió cambiar el giro de su negocio. Su hijo la apoya llevándola a comprar zapato León Guanajuato, México. Inició su negocio invirtiendo el dinero que tenía en una tanda y se estableció en su domicilio. Decidió invertir su dinero en la venta de zapatos porque nos comento que prefiere sacar ganancias de su dinero que gastarlo. Su parte favorita del negocio es que puede ver su dinero crecer en vez de gastarlo y que ella administra su propio negocio. Algunas de los desafíos que  ha enfrentado su negocio es el aumento de la  competencia, pues   hay más puestos de zapatos en el mercado. Además de las inclemencias del clima que a veces no la dejan vender. El préstamo de KIVA y Fundación Realidad lo va utilizar para comprar más calzado de otro tipo para que la gente le compre más.
La señora Rosalía M. es casada, su esposo es campesino, tiene 10 hijos todos ya se casaron y viven aparte, nadie más vive en su casa y nadie de su familia la ayuda con su negocio. So  comunidad le gusta porque es donde ella nació y la gente es amble y se conocen entre todos. Su negocio le ha ayudado a salir adelante con los gastos de su casa y para aumentar su negocio. Los planes que tiene para el futuro son sembrar unas tierras que tiene en los campos de labranza de la localidad. Se siente contenta de recibir el apoyo de KIVA  y fundación Realidad para llevar a cabo sus planes. Sus palabras para el equipo de KIVA fueron las siguientes “…les doy las gracias por el préstamo que nos dan (sic)  y por atendernos para que nuestro negocio crezca…”
texts.en:
Rosa M. I., 69, lives in the municipal seat of Axochiapan, Morelos, México.  She did not finish elementary school.  She is going to use the loan to stock merchandise in her footwear sales business.  She sells women’s and men’s shoes on Saturdays and Sundays in Axochiapan’s main square.  She has had this business for three years.  She used to sell food in the same stand in the market but she was told that selling shoes was a better business and she decided to change the nature of her business.  Her son helps her by taking her to buy shoes in León, Guanajuato, México.

She started the business investing the money she had saved in a tanda (an association formed upon a core of participants who agree to make regular contributions to a fund which is given in whole or in part to each contributor in rotation) and set up shop in her house.  She decided to invest her money in shoe sales because she commented that she’d rather earn profits with her money than spend it.  Her favorite part of the business is watching her money grow rather than spending it and that she can run her own business.  Some of the challenges she has faced is the increase in competition because there are a lot of shoe stands in the market.  Besides, sometimes the inclemency of the weather prevents her from selling.  She will use the Kiva and Fundación Realidad loan to buy more shoes in a style that people will buy more of.

Mrs. Rosalía M. is married.  Her husband is a farmer.  She has ten children.  All are married and living elsewhere.  No one else lives in her house and no one in her family helps her with her business.

She likes her community because that’s where she was born and the people are kind and know each other well. Her business has helped her get ahead with her household expenses and to enlarge the business.  Plans for the future include planting some farmland she has in the local farming area.

She is happy to get help from Kiva and Fundación Realidad to reach her goals.  Her words for the Kiva team are the following: “…I thank you for the loan that you give us (sic) and for taking care of us so that our business grows…”

loans.use: To buy shoes, boots and sandals for women and men.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en:
Gantulga is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. He and his family live in an apartment. His youngest son attends a local secondary school and his wife works as a cook for the local cafe. She helps him with the business in her free time by taking orders from his customers. Gantulga operates a wood products business in his town. He designs and produces many different styles and sizes of furniture that he sells throughout his community. He started his business in 2000 with a capital of 350,000 MNT that was used to buy the necessary equipment and tools for his carpentry business. 

Today, his business is well established in the local area, and his working capital exceeds 1,300,000 MNT. For the future, he says, "My main business goal is to establish my own carpentry factory." 

Gantulga is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more wood supplies to make furniture.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies of wood

loans.name: Rolando José

texts.es:
El señor C. U. ya tiene tres años de laborar en una empresa ubicada en el Municipio de Masaya como Operador de Pozo, con este ingreso sufraga los gastos de su familia en el que tiene cuatro niños que están en edad escolar.

En estos momentos como su familia está creciendo está teniendo la necesidad de realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación, debido a esto es que se decidió visitar las oficinas de CEPRODEL para solicitar un crédito y realizar el mejoramiento de vivienda y de esta forma cumplir con sus sueños.

Este señor está consiente que haciendo esta obra estaría mejorando el nivel de vida que tendría su familia.
texts.en: Mr. C. U. has worked in a business in the municipality of Masaya as a well operator for three years.  He takes care of the household expenses with this income.  He has four school-age children and at this time, with his family growing, he needs to make some improvements to his home. This is why he decided to visit the Ceprodel office to take out a loan to make some home improvements and in this way realize his dreams.  This señor is aware  that this work will improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: Home improvement.

loans.name: Josphat Kingori

texts.en:
Josphat, who has practised mixed farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 20 years, is 39 years old, married to Tabitha Njeri, and they have three children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and this will be his second loan. Josphat repaid his previous loan of Kshs 40,000 well and in good time, and plans to use this loan to buy four cows which he will sell later at a profit.

In the future, Josphat hopes to pursue large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy four cows which he will sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en: Fatmeh is 28 years old and single.  She lives in Bint Jbeil and owns a perfume and artificial flowers shop, which she has had since 2004. Fatmeh is well known in her area and her business is improving every day. Most of her clients are friends, neighbors, and relatives. Fatmeh is a hard worker and seeks the best for her business.  She was helped by her family members because she has good taste in making perfumes of her own.  She makes special blends and sells them for a good price so they can be affordable to all of her clients. Fatmeh is requesting a loan for the first time from Al Majmoua in order to increase her business capital. Fatmeh is a responsible woman, who struggles with her business and takes care of her parents as much as she can. Fatmeh hopes she can expand her perfume sales in the region.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Emelia's Group

texts.en: Emelia L. owns and operates a store selling a variety of food products in her community. She is 57 years old, married and has four grown-up children. They are from the village of Sta. Ana, Aloran, Mis. Occ. Emelia has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Emelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Emelia L.'s group is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and bread for sale. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. Emelia is the leader of a 3 member group accessing a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and bread for sale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production/sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food vending business.

Cynthia has been in this business for 15 years. Cynthia earns more income with fish vending and pig fattening.

Cynthia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of expanding her business and engaging in rice retailing in the future.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a young woman from Jabalia refugee camp in Gaza Strip. Fatima's husband has a construction supplies store. He sells the wood used in construction.

Fatima's husband, who appears in the picture here as Fatima is a conservative woman as are most Gaza Strip inhabitants, needed $1500 to purchase more wood to answer his customers' demand. Fatima took out the loan from FATEN so her husband can purchase the amount he needs.

loans.use: to purchase wood sold by her husband for construction.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es: Marino, de 48 años de edad, natural del distrito de San Miguel, convive con Eugenia de 50  años de edad y juntos viven en su propia casa con sus 07 hijos donde reina la armonía. La labor que realiza Marino es labrar la tierra, donde cultiva cacao, café y plátano, en total cuenta con 06 hectáreas de terreno. Sus padres le enseñaron a remover la tierra y con el tiempo acumuló dinero para que pueda comprar su propia parcela. Es conocedor del arduo trabajo en el campo; donde viene trabajando 22 años en sus propias tierras, en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y jornaleros quienes se encargan de trasladar los productos cosechados hasta cierto tramo; para luego poder comercializarlos. Se siente muy comprometido con su trabajo; porque gracias a su esfuerzo cotidiano hoy disfruta al ver que sus plantas le resultan, así obteniendo buenas ganancias; cuenta además que la temporada de invierno no es de su agrado, porque son meses donde abundan mayor cantidad de insectos perjudicando así sus sembríos. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro préstamo con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal. El crédito solicitado es para la de compra de plantas de cacao para injertarlos y sacar buen provecho de sus frutos en menor tiempo.
texts.en:
Marino, 48, is from San Miguel District.  He lives with Eugenia, 50, in their own house where harmony reigns with their 7 children.  Marino is a cocoa bean, coffee and banana farmer.   He has a total of 6 hectares of farmland.  His parents taught him how to till the soil and in time he saved up money to buy his own parcel.  He knows what hard field work is for he’s been working his own lands for 22 years.  

During harvest time he is helped by his children and hired field hands who transport the harvested fruit a certain distance to be sold.  He feels very committed to his work because, thanks to his daily efforts, today he enjoys watching the results his plants produce: good profits. He comments that he’s not very fond of winter because insects that damage his crops are abundant during those months.

This is his 12th loan with MFP.  He knows that if he repays it on time he’ll be able to access another loan more easily and not create problems for his communal bank.  He will use the requested loan to buy cocoa bean plants to graft and get profits from them in a shorter time.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie is 37 years old and married with two school-aged children. His wife is an Overseas Filipino Worker in Singapore. To help his wife support their daily needs and educational needs of their children, Regie engages in a hog-raising business.

Regie is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase feed and vitamins needed by his raised hogs. According to Regie, his borrowed loan will be of great help in making his animals healthier.

In the future, Regie aims to have a bigger business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his hogs.

loans.name: Sonya

texts.en:
Sonya is a 28-year-old lady. She is married to Bernard, a 37-year-old man who is currently working in a private company. Sonya and Bernard are blessed with a son, Kiand, who is one year old. 

Sonya and her family are living with her mother-in-law and a sister-in-law in a modest house. Sonya operates a computer rental business in order to support her husband in meeting their family needs. Actually this business has been running for 4 years, since Bernard was still single. Now, Bernard is working in another company, so Sonya took over the business.

Sonya is grateful as the income generated from the business can be added to her husband’s income. Her business income depends on how many costumers she has and how many hours the customers spend on the computer. Currently Sonya has 3 computers to be rented but it is not enough to meet the customers’ needs. Sonya wants to add one more computer for her business so she will be able to generate more income and better meet her family's needs. 

Sonya would like to request a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM. She wants to purchase one computer for her business. Sonya hopes that her loan application will be approved by TLM so she can improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase one computer.

loans.name: Jennyfer

texts.en:
Jennyfer is married with one child. She is 18 years old and lives in Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. To earn a living, she sells snacks in public areas, outdoor conventions and events, and beaches. She earns about $115 per month by doing this type of work. However, the income of being a hawker is not enough to sustain her family's daily consumption. 

She wanted to have additional capital to make many foods that she can sell everyday, that can multiply her income. Jennyfer went to GDMPC and she requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for preparing food for sale.

Jennyfer has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future she hopes that she can build a refreshment building.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Monica Del Rocio

texts.en:
Monica is 23 years old and lives in Otavalo, a market town in northern Ecuador. She is single and lives with her parents. Monica is looking for the best for her business and her studies. She is very entrepreneurial.

Her business is a general store where she specializes in selling groceries. She is obtaining this loan to purchase more groceries for sale to increase her business. She began her business with her grandmother and has been working to improve the business with great effort. This loan is Monica's first, and she hopes it will help her achieve her goals to obtain a larger store. 

In the future, she hopes that her family with grow and have more resources.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kuttubek's Group

texts.en:
Kuttubek, 34, is a member of this group. He is married and brings up three kids. Kuttubek makes a living by working as a coach in a local sports school, while his wife is also a teacher. Six years ago he bought two calves and sent them to grow in the highlands. The fattening and reselling of livestock brings 3 000 soms monthly, which has allowed the family to build a house. The purpose of this loan is for the purchase of more livestock for further fattening and reselling. In the future Kuttubek plans to build a shed to keep the livestock in better conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
	
 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
 MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Kiraaro Twekambe Group

texts.en:
Peter is a 59-year-old married man with 12 children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to own a market stall in the central market of Fort Portal town.

He has been a tomato vendor for the last 15 years and the major hardship faced is price fluctuations for tomatoes. Peter needs the loan to buy tomatoes to sell.

loans.use: To buy a tomato garden.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. 

Anita has a food shop that sells snacks, like rice & cassava cakes. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.  Anita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Anita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and a single mother of three children. 

Ruth has a grocery store. She has applied for her first loan of KES 5,000. She will use the money to buy more onions to add to her stock.

She hopes to own a food kiosk in the future.

loans.use: To buy onions to add to her stock.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis de cincuenta y seis años de edad habita en su propia casa con su esposa. José ha trabajado toda su vida para poder tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida. Con grandes esfuerzos ha logrado establecer una pequeña carpintería en su hogar de residencia ya que no cuenta con otro lugar para poder colocar su negocio, debido a limitaciones económicas. El negocio es rentable ya que por mucho tiempo  ha logrado sacarlo adelante y darle el pan de cada día a él y a su querida esposa. Su deseo es ver florecer su negocio y para esto ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de la materia prima necesaria como: madera, pega y herramientas para seguir manteniendo su negocio un paso adelante de la  competencia. Además desea poder mejorar sus ingresos y confía en Dios que así será. De esta manera espera lograr mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Luis, 50, lives in his own home with his wife. He has worked all his life to be able to have access to a better quality of life. Through great effort, he has succeeded in establishing a small carpentry shop in his home since he has no other place for his business, due to economic restraints.

José’s business is profitable because he has worked for a long time to get ahead and provide food each day for himself and his dear wife. His wish is to see his business flourish and, for this to happen, he has decided to request this loan from Integral in order to buy necessary basic materials such as wood, glue and tools in order to continue keeping his business a step ahead of the competition. In addition, he wants to be able to increase his income and he trusts in God that it will happen. In this way, he hopes to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy necessary basic materials such as wood, glue and tools.

loans.name: Dodo

texts.fr:
Dodo est une femme âgé(e) de 60ans. Elle est mariée å un militaire retraité. Elle a 05 enfants dont 01 à l’école. Le premier a 35 ans et le dernier a 13 ans.  
Dodo travaille comme revendeuse de céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho) et des ignames depuis 1975. Elle sert tout le monde à la maison et au marché. 
Dodo a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des ignames et des céréales. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Dodo voudrait faire prospérer son commerce. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle veut être stable financièrement.
texts.en:
Dodo, age 60, is married to a retired soldier. She has five children, out of whom one attends school. The firstborn is 35, the youngest one is 13. Dodo has been selling cereals (corn, millet, sorghum) and yams since 1975. She serves a wide variety of customer at her home and at the market.

Dodo is seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy yams and cereals. She wants to reinvest in her business. In the forthcoming years, she would like to make her business thrive. She says that, thanks to her profits, she wants to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy cereals and yams

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es: Herminia D. cincuenta y uno años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos dentro D. una comunidad al norte del país y muy cerca a la capital. Ella posee un taller D. costura, donD. confecciona todo tipo D. ropa, faldas, camisas, vestidos, para damas, caballeros y niños al gusto del cliente, el lugar del negocio es muy estratégico y se ha hecho D. mucha clientela en los últimos 10 años, pues su trabajo es D. mucha calidad y tiene precios accesibles; el servicio es excelente; para Herminia la vida es una oportunidad diaria y quiere aprovecharla al máximo, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar telas por mayor, hilos, agujas entre otros que permitan reducir sus costos y poder adquirir mayores margenes D. ganancias. Herminia tiene la esperanza  que con su trabajo podrá dar a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida
texts.en:
Herminia, at 51 years of age, lives with her life partner and her children in a community in the north of the country, very close to the capital. She has a seamstress shop where she produces all types of clothing, including skirts, shirts, dresses, and women's, men's, and children's clothing on demand. Her business location is very advantageous and she has developed a large clientele over the past 10 years, as her work is of high quality and she offers reasonable prices and excellent service. 

For Herminia, life is a daily opportunity and she likes to make the most of it. That's why she is taking out this loan from Apoyo Integral [Kiva field partner] to buy wholesale clothe, thread, and needles, among other items, that will reduce her costs and allow her to increase her profit margins. Herminia has hope that through her work she will be able to proviD. a higher quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothe, thread, and needles.

loans.name: Nemarrau

texts.en: Nemarrau, 31-year-old married father of two, has been a farmer for the past six years.  This will be his first loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to buy farm inputs like manure, seedlings . With the profits generated, he plans to pay school fees for his children. An assiduous man who works with effort to attain more despite limited resources, Nemarrau dreams of being a prominent farmer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, manure, seedlings.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este comité denominado Kuña Marangatu, surgió por contacto D. una D. las señoras con la fundación. Actualmente está integrado por 15 mujeres, el grupo se encuentra en el ciclo número 20 del programa, operan con la Fundación desD. el año 2006.
Alba, es una D. las miembros del comité, ella se dedica a la venta D. calzados D. todo tipo, este trabajo le permite salir adelante día a día y mantener a su familia y a los que D. ella dependen. Comenta que le va muy bien en el negocio por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con el. Ella se considera una mujer muy trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. calzados, con lo cual podrá tener más variedad D. productos para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le dan
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Kuña Marangatu, came about through contact with one of the ladies of the Fundacion. Currently it consists of 15 women. It is in its 20th loan cycle with the program and they have worked with the Fundacion since 2006. 

Alba is one of the members of the group. She sells all types of footwear. This work allows her to get ahead on a daily basis and take care of her family and those that depend on her. She tells us that she is doing very well and so would like to continue running the business. She considers herself to be a very hardworking, enterprising and determined woman.

She is asking for the loan to buy footwear with which to have a wider variety of products to offer her customers. She is thankful to the Fundacion and Kiva for the opportunity given her.

loans.use: to buy footwear for later sale.

loans.name: Urginia

texts.es:
Urginia es socia del Banco Comunal “Aymaras Juli II” del, distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y tiene tres hijos.  Cuenta con estudios superiores.

Desde hace dos años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de bayetas (telas).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará 12 kilos de lana de diferentes colores, quince metros de bayeta y algunos materiales para construir su casa como yeso, cemento.  La artesanía la vende en Puno y Juli.
Ella cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien trabaja en una Institución de la zona.

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal  son las charlas y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Urginia is a member of the “Aymaras Juli II” communal bank in Juli District, Chucuito Province and Puno Department.  She’s 40 years old, married and has three children.  She completed higher education.

She’s been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for two years.  Her first loan was for 300 new soles that she invested in the purchase of baize (fabric).

She will use this new, 1000 new sol, loan to buy 12 kilos of yarn in different colors and 15 meters of baize as well as some building materials and supplies like plaster and cement.  She sells her crafts in Puno and Juli.  Her husband, who works for a local institution, helps her out.  Her dream is that her children become professionals.  What she enjoys the most about her communal bank is the talks and the meetings.

loans.use: to buy twelve kilos of yarn in assorted colors and fifteen meters of baize.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en:
Hien is 31 years old. She lives in Nguyet Cau village, Yen Phong Bac Ninh. She is married and she has one child who is going to school. 

She not only grows rice, but also she sells fast food. She has had this job for five years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

She sometimes needs a loan to expand her business, so she has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8,288,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the fifth time she borrows from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9,184,000 VND to buy pork, chicken and spices to produce fast food.

loans.use: to buy pork, chicken and spices to produce fast food.

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru: Ёкуб примерный семьянин, заботливый  отец пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Вместе с детьми они ведут хозяйство по разведению крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. У них  своя ферма. На ферме работают все дети после занятий. Он старается  воспитать детей  трудолюбивыми. Он запрашивает займ для постройки дома и надеется в поддержке добрых людей. Он верит в то, что получит займ и заранее благодарен тем, кто предоставит его.
texts.en: Yokub is an exemplary family man and a caring father of five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Together with the children, they run a business of breeding cattle and small livestock and have their own farm.  All of the children work on the farm after school.  Yokub tries to raise his children to be hardworking people.  He is requesting this loan to build a house and hopes to get the support of kind people.  He believes that he will get this loan and thanks those, who provide it, in advance.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Teresa sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Teresa con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Teresa solicita el préstamo para invertir en la comprar mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos y entre otros. 
	
Teresa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Teresa continues participating in Asociación Arariwa's “Choquequirao” communal bank from the city of Cusco. Teresa continues selling craftwork like textiles, shawls, gloves, hats, baby clothes, large blankets, ponchos, cardigans and ceramic decorations.

The previous loan went very well for her, and she was able to make a good profit. This is why she wants another loan, because it helps her business a lot.

Teresa is asking for the loan to buy blankets, banners, clothing for saints' statues, woolen caps and other items.
	
Teresa is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this medium, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase materials for clothes making

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa is 64 years old and a widow with 9 children.

Basilisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more products for her sari-sari store. Basilisa has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Basilisa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more products for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Azra's Group

texts.en:
Azra is a housewife, and she stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is a very efficient woman and performs her duties very well. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and performs transportation services to his passengers, and also picks and drops off school children.

Azra has given birth to five sons and one daughter. None of them could get an education, due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is a rickshaw driver, while the others stay at home.

Azra has applied for a loan for her husband, who wants to repair his autorickshaw. By doing this, he will be able to provide better transport services to his passengers and increase his income. Azra has a lot of confidence in her husband and is very much sure that an investment will help him make his business more profitable, and her family will be able to live a better financial life in result.

Note: In the photo,"the woman holding a book (called "Asasah Passbook") is Azra.

loans.use: to repair a rickshaw for a transportation business.

loans.name: Hurmatoy

texts.ru: Хурматой жительница района Кубадиён. Она добрая, отзывчивая и приятная женщина. Хурматой любит помогать людям и считает это своим призванием в жизни. Поэтому она пошла учиться на врача. Хурматой работает врачом в местной больнице. Ее работа очень ответственная, ведь на ее плечи возложена жизни людей. Хурматой много времени проводит на работе, но старается уделять больше внимания своей матери. Хурматой живет с мамой одни. В дом доход приносит только Хурматой. Она с мамой долго копили денег на ремонт, но так и не собрав достаточную сумму отложили ремонт. Зима пришла очень холодной и Хурматой и у мамы были трудности с сохранением тепла в доме. Хурматой как врач и дочь заботится о маме и не хочет, чтоб повторились снова жилищные трудности в зимний период. Она больше не собирается откладывать ремонт и обращается за кредитом.
texts.en:
Hurmatoy is a 29-year-old resident of the Qubadiyon region. She is a kind, sympathetic and pleasant young woman. Hurmatoy enjoys helping people and considers it her calling. That is why she studied to become a doctor. For four years already, she has been working as a doctor in a local hospital. Hurmatoy’s work is very important since she is responsible for people’s lives. 

Although she spends a lot of time at work, Hurmatoy still tries to devote enough time to care for her mother. Hurmatoy lives with her mother alone. The only source of income for the family comes from Hurmatoy’s work. Her mother and she had been saving money for renovations for a long time, but being unable to save enough, they postponed the work. Then winter came and it was very cold, forcing Hurmatoy and her mother to struggle to keep the house warm. As a doctor, Hurmatoy cares for her mother’s health and doesn’t want to face the same difficulty during the winter again. She is not going to postpone renovations any further, which is why she requested a loan.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Irene Narciza

texts.es: Irene tiene 25 años de edad, es de estado civil casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen un hijo, Cristian de 7 años de edad, quien estudia en una institución de su localidad, ella se dedica hace 5 años a la producción de leche, ya que esto se ha convertido en un ingreso económico, ella solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca de leche para aumentar su producción y por ende sus ingresos, y así puede ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar.

loans.use: para la compra de una vaca de leche

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence Restaurant, a 51 years old caterer from a historic area of Benin City, specializes in providing special food for people in her community. She plans to improve her business with a minimum loan of $500.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for cooking

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase computer accessories and hire two assistants for his computer repairs business

loans.name: Tohir

texts.en:
Inragimov Tohir, 46 years old, graduated from secondary school. He is married and has 5 children. He worked for a few years out of the country (in Russia), and 2 1/2 years ago he came back to his family and started his own small business. He has a wholesale trading point in Tijorat market of the Yavan district and sells footwear.

He is going to use the loan amount to increase his assortment of summer footwear. Since he is doing wholesale trading, the prices at his trading point are significantly lower than competitors are offering. It helps the poor population of the district, which does not have stable and good salaries to avail themselves of cheap footwear for summer time.

loans.use: Increase footwear assortment

loans.name: Ilda Simão

texts.pt:
Ilda Simao L. is 40 years old. She lives with her husband and 5 children in the neighborhood of Canico, in Maputo. She owns a small grocery shop in her home, where she sells food and drinks.

Ilda joined the Development Fund of Women Program in February 2006 and her first loan was of 5.000MT. She is on the 4th stage of the program. Ilda plans on borrowing 15.000MT to invest on her business. She plans on re-paying the loan in a 6 months period. Ilda's business has experienced memorable growth after she joined the program.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Ilda Simão L. tem 40 anos de Idade,vive maritalmente e é mãe de 5 filhos.Vive no bairro polna Caniço em Maputo. Uma pequena mercearia em casa onde vende diversos produtos alimentares e bebidas.

Entrou para o aprograma em Fevereiro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000 MT. Vai para o quarto ciclo de empréstimo e pretende tomar 15.000 Mt para pagar em 6 meses, o qual vai investir no negócio. Tem teve um crescimento assinalável do negócio depois que começou a tomar os empréstimos uma vez que todos os montantes são aplicados no mesmo.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Aniva

texts.en: A. is a 37 year old mother of two, who struggles to make ends meet financially.  This is mainly due to the fact that her husband doesn’t earn much as a bus driver.  However, Anivas' determination to satisfy her family needs drove her to start up her screen printing elei business. She borrowed from SPBD to purchase all materials needed to start up.  She sells to the locals and some tourists passing through her village of Safaatoa Uta.  This helps her to earn $120 a week after all expenses.  She is now able to help her husband with his weekly earnings of $120.

loans.use: For home improvement and for supplies for her elei screen printing business

loans.name: Francisca Franco

texts.en:
Francisca is a 24-year-old mother of two children and she dedicates herself, together with her husband, to the sales of fish. She has been running that business for more than one year.

Weekly, Francisca’s husband goes Santo Domingo, the capital, to buy the fish in a fish shop. In the house, they have a freezer to preserve the fish. Francisca sells the goods from home, while her husband sells in the streets. Actually, the entrepreneur buys a small amount of fish since she doesn’t have a very spacious freezer. She hopes she can get a used one before long.

The entrepreneur would like to add new products to her business. Her plan is to use her loan and buy many kinds of shellfish so that she can diversify her inventory and satisfy and attract more clients.

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of shellfish to introduce to her fish selling business.

loans.name: María Immacula

texts.en:
Immacula is a 33-year-old woman that recently seperated from her husband.  She is bravely raising her two daughters by herself.   The children both attend her school.

Immacula is the manager of a school she founded three years ago for the children of her community.  Currently, more than 200 children go to her school.  As a visionary manager, Immacula plans to computerize the school in a few years.  She wants to install electronic blackboards, a computer room for the teachers as well as one for the pupils.

In the meantime, Imacula needs to resolve the school's present issues.  She is requesting funds to buy new chairs for the pupils and to repair some desks.  Immacula says that with God’s help and a lot of effort she will achieve her goals.

loans.use: To purchase new chairs and repair desks at a new school.

loans.name: Ramón

texts.es:
Mr. Ramon M.’ business is the sale of footwear. This has been his business for 21 years in the city of Leon in Nicaragua. It is a very popular business in this market because he sells all kind of shoes, of different colors and sizes. He sells both women and men shoes.

He is married and has three children, he works hard to provide for them and fulfill all their needs. He opens his business every day from very early in the morning and begins to work with the support of his wife and children. His goal is to extend his premises and offer greater amounts of shoes and the best styles, the best brands and in addition the best prices to get more costumers.

He has borrowed money from Ceprodel that he has used to buy greater amounts of footwear and to cover his family needs. His loan’s record is 10 loans with Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

La venta de calzados es el negocio al que se dedica el señor Ramón M. desde hace 21 años en la ciudad de León en Nicaragua. Su negocio es muy común en el sector de calzados de este mercado debido a que oferta zapatos de todo tipo, todo color y todo tamaño para damas y para caballeros.

Es casado y con tres hijos a su responsabilidad por los que lucha fuertemente para mantenerlos y brindarle todas sus necesidades. Todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana abre su negocio y comienza a trabajar con el apoyo de su esposa y de sus hijos. Su meta es ampliar su local y brindar mayores cantidades de zapatos con los mejores estilos, las mejores marcas y además los mejores precios para así ganar mas clientelas en su local.

Consiente de la necesidad de invertir ha realizado créditos en Ceprodel que los ha utilizado para la adquisición de mayores cantidades de calzados y para las necesidades de su hogar. Su record crediticio es de 10 créditos con Ceprodel.

loans.use: To buy footwear

loans.name: Ismail

texts.en: Ismail M. is a 51-year-old trader who keeps a small store where he sells men's clothes, shells and other items. He is married and has four children. Ismail is a repeat borrower from Aqroinvest; he borrowed two loans and successfully repaid them on time. Now Ismail is going to expand his business and diversify the number of products.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Mrs. Nelly C. P. is a member of the Community Bank "Los Eucaliptos". She lives in the San Martín region, in the province of San Martín and the district of Morales. Her business is located in her own home in the housing development Pueblo Joven "9 de Abril". She has been working for 20 years selling perfume and cosmetics of many brands including Esika, Avon and Unique. She sells her products on order and by catalog. Her most important clients are the workers in public and private institutions.

With this loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian currency), which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy a variety of articles such as perfumes, creams, shampoos, make-up, deoderant and other products of brands that offer discounted prices during this season of the year. With this purchase her business will be well-stocked with a wider range of products and she will be able to satisfy her clients.

She is 40 years old and lives with her husband and 2 sons. She dreams of seeing her sons grow into professionals. That dream motivates her to work every day with a lot of perseverance. She hopes to have a grocery business in the future.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nelly C. P., es socia del banco comunal “Los Eucaliptos” vive en el departamento de San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de Morales , su negocio esta ubicado en su propia casa del Pueblo Joven 9 de abril, se dedica hace 22 años a la venta de artículos de perfumería y cosméticos de diferentes marcas como Esika, Avon, Unique, que lo vende a través de pedidos y por catalogo,siendo sus principales clientes los trabajadores de instituciones públicas y privadas.

Con el crédito de S/. 1,200.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses, comprará diversos artículos como perfumes, cremas, champús, jabones, maquillajes, desodorante y otros productos mas, de estas marcas que salen en ofertas en esta temporada para tener en stock y variar sus productos para así satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes.

Tiene 40 años vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos a quienes desea verlos profesionales, razón por el que día a día trabaja con mucha perseverancia, anhelando mas adelante tener un negocio de venta de abarrotes.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy products for her business.

loans.name: Roda

texts.en:
Roda is 42 years old and is married woman with 5 children, ages 4-20 years old. Roda is a clothes seller, she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 8am to 4pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $130 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Lilieni

texts.en: Lilieni T., 19, is married with one child.  She has worked as a vegetable gardener for the last two years, and six days a week sells her produce to the public and the people of her village at the main market in town. She has taken out one previous loan from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be about $291.  SPBD loans are Lilieni’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. Part of the loan will be used to expand her house, or for repairs. Her husband helps her operate her business on Friday and Saturday and works at the local gas station from Monday to Thursday.

loans.use: Purchase cucumber, cabbage, tomato and pumpkin seeds, along with beans and fertilizer.

loans.name: Enith

texts.es:
Enith is the only lady selling fruit in her community and therefore here clients’ demands are large and very satisfactory. Daily she spends hours of attention and joy with each and every housewife that visits her, and her wish to improve is centered on the development of her little ones. Your response and immediate support would contribute to make her dream come true as it is her wish to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Enith, dentro de su zona es la única dama que comercializa frutas y debido a esta razón la demanda de sus clientes es amplia y muy satisfactoria. A diario dedica horas enteras de atención y alegría a cada una de las amas de casa que la visitan y su deseo de mejora se centra en el desarrollo de cada uno de sus pequeños. Vuestra respuesta y ayuda inmediata podrá contribuir con el cumplimiento D. deseo de ampliación de su negocio.

loans.use: Enlarge a small sales stand.

loans.name: Keang

texts.en:
Mrs. Keang S.,39, and her husband, Mr. Mengtich Ly, 49, who live in a small village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh, married in 1990 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in local school.

Mrs. Keang has been selling vegetables for two years. She buys them from Ta Khmao market for re-sale at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for fifteen years. His motorcycle scooter is very old and breaks down very often.

So, Keang is requesting a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a new motorcycle to replace the old one for her husband to drive as a motor taxi and to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorbike for running a motor taxi and expand business of selling vegetables

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth M. is a married woman. She resides in the Temeke District in Dar es Salaam. She has a poultry business. She keeps both layers and broilers. It takes almost six months for layers to get the first harvest, while broilers take three years. She meets the daily demands of her family with her business. Her plan is to expand the business to increase sales. She needs a loan of $900 to meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.fr: FatmaW. est une Femme mère de trois enfants qui habite au quartier des parcelles assainies de thiès. elle gére un restaurant au quarter Randoulene de thiés depuis plus de dix ans. elle est societaire  de l'IMCEC depuis 2003 et a bénéficié de plusieurs prets qu'elle a remboursé sans problème.. elle sollicite ce nouveau pret dans le but de mieux développer son activité.
texts.en:
Fatma W. is the mother of three children and lives in the district called Parcelles Assainies in Thiès. She has managed a little restaurant in the neighborhood called Randoulene in Thiés for more than 10 years. She has belonged to IMCEC since 2003 and has had several loans that she reimbursed without problems. She is asking for this new loan in order to further develop her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: developing her little restaurant business

loans.name: Mwaidi

texts.en: Mwaidi has had a business selling food in Zanzibar for three years. She is 27 years old, divorced, and has two children, ages 2 and 6.  She owns a shop selling food where she works every day from 5:00am to 6:00pm. She is currently able to earn a profit of approximately $65 each month. She is hoping that this loan increases her profit and expands her business.

loans.use: Mwaidi would like to expand her food-selling business

loans.name: Dinhthi

texts.vi:
Chị L. tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2002. Gia đình chị có 6 người con trong đó 5 người con đã trưởng thành. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi ngan vịt để phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Hàng tháng với mức thu nhập từ chăn nuôi gia đình, lương làm cán bộ của chồng và sự hỗ trợ của con đi lao động xuất khẩu khoảng 5.000.000đ  kinh tế gia đình chị  rất ổn định, việc hoàn trả vốn cũng rất thuận lợi.
 Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 10.000.000đ một phần chị sử dụng để mua ngan, vịt  về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng để mua thức ăn phục vụ cho công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs L. is a TYM fund member since 2002. She has 6 children, 5 of them are grown up. She and her family raise barbary ducks for a living. Her husband is an officer. Her family has a stable income: his salary, their children's salaries and revenue from the suck business total 5.000.000 VND a month. She does not have problem making the weekly payment. This time she is requesting a loan of 10.000.000 VND to buy feed and baby ducks to raise

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baby ducks and feed

loans.name: Uju

texts.en: Uju is a single parent. She is 35 years old and has 2 children that she takes care of by herself. Uju sells secondhand clothes. The demand for her clothing is high. Uju lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Uju needs the loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell to her customers. She is very grateful to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Dilan Satan

texts.fr: Dilan Satan S., 59 ans, mariée, 05 enfants scolarisés en charge est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 3 ans. Son activité consiste à acheter et revendre des robes et ensembles africains. Les revenus tirés de son commerce vont lui permettre d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Dilan Satan S., age 59, is married and has five children in school who are in her care. She has been a member of the village loan group of Peyrissac for three years. Her work consists in buying and reselling dresses and African suits. The income derived from her commerce is going to allow her to improve her family's living conditions. The loan she is requesting will be repaid all at once at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in dresses and African outfits

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Шарипов Мухаббат проживает в районе Гиссар. Возраст 37 лет, незамужем и имеет троих детей. Работает педагогом в средней школе. Но после того как она осталась одна с тремя детьми на руках ей пришлось заняться бизнесом. Торгует коврами на центральном рынке Гиссара. Кредит планирует использовать для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Muhabbat S. lives in the Gissar region. She is 37 years old, not married and has three children. She works as a teacher in junior high school. After she was left alone with 3 children she had to go into business to support them. Muhabbat sells carpets at the central market in Gissar. She plans to use the loan to increase sales. She will repay her loan in 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Gultakin

texts.en: Gultakin M. is 35-year-old woman who has been breeding calves for the last 12 years. Gultakin is married and has two children. Cattle breeding is the only financial source for her family. Gultakin purchases baby calves, fattens them and then sells to the local people. She applied for $1200 to purchase two calves and expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase two calves.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel Fernández T. se ve ala necesidad de ampliar su casa ya que donde vive es muy pequeño ya que son casas de interés social y todas son del mismo tamaño. Con el  préstamo empezaría  la construcción de un cuarto en la parte de atrás para extender sala comedor. 
El es una persona trabajadora la cual ha permanecido en una maquiladora desde hace 9 años al igual que su esposa es de la manera que calificaron para obtener su casa pero ahora quieren hacerle mejoras para el bienestar de ellos como también el de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Miguel F. T. sees a need to expand the house where he lives, a government house that like other similar houses are the same small size. With the loan, he would begin building a room in the back of the house to extend the living-dining room outwards. He's a hard-working man who, for 9 years, has worked at the same factory where his wife works. That's how they qualified to get their house but now they want to improve it for the well-being of their children as well as themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials.

loans.name: Mihail

texts.en:
Mihail is a very honest and responsible man at his job, and he performs it well. He likes cars, and he is familiar with all the details of a motor vehicle. Three years ago, Mihail opened a car wash that is famous in his town. For 3 years he has managed to attract quite a few clients who trust the services provided by Mihail. This year he has decided to expand his business by supplementing the equipment necessary, such as a water pressure device, technical clothing, chemicals and other things, so that customers will have a desire to use Mihail's services in the future .

He decided to borrow a loan Microinvest to buy the necessary equipment and materials.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and materials.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac E. is 39 years old and married with three children. He sells drinks and provisions.

Isaac hopes for a loan in the amount of N40000 in order to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell.

loans.name: Channa

texts.en: Mr. Channa K. is villager in Krang Thnang village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money to hire laborer with two oxen to plow the field. He has decided to ask for a loan to buy a buffalo to use with his old buffalo to plow on the field and to reduce his expenses. His wife, Mrs. Saem Sokhun, owns a poultry business. Mr. Channa K. is 25 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. He and his wife are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to use with his old buffalo to plow the field and to reduce his expenses.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P., 43, is a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. Married, she has devoted her life to her business for the future of her family. She tried selling “puto” (rice pancake snack). Her loyal customers are her relatives and neighbors.

Lorna is in her third year of membership to Paglaum MPC where she gets working capital. She feels fulfilled. Lorna applied for php7,000 for her snack vending business. Lorna hopes she will become a big-time business woman.

loans.use: Capital for snack vending.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
C. Shahodat is 52 years old. For fifteen years Shahodat has been working as a market vendor. She sells plates and dishes made in an oriental style in the central local market, which are very popular among the local populace. This kind of china is also widely used for girls' dowry and also for family celebrations. Now Shahodat is planning to enlarge the range of goods she sells by purchasing more china. Hence, she is requesting 2,000 Somoni. Shahodat is an existing IMON client with good credit history, and promises to repay the loan promptly. She thanks everyone supporting her.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road. It has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities who still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Till today, it remains a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. Civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous with only 7% of the land being arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural and manufacturing sectors, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase oriental-style plates and dishes

loans.name: Antonio Sopeai

texts.en:
Antonio Sopeai M. is originally from the city of Zavala, but currently resides in Boane, a suburb of Maputo, the capital of Mozambique. Antonio originally moved from Zavala to Maputo in search of work when he was 30. Due to the civil war, his wife and children were only able to join him many years later.

Antonio is now 55 and his children are 15 and 12. Both are currently in school. On top of supporting his immediate family Antonio also sends remittance payments to his mother in Zavala.

Antonio is employed as a bartender at Restaurante Imperial in Boane. He is requesting this loan to help finance the construction of his home. This will be his third loan from Hluvuku. The other three he has successfully paid back.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila L. is from the village of Cento Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 41 years old and has school-aged children. She is separated from her husband.
